Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near Pantheon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyLA
Reviews.Content: Great smallish hotel in the 5th arrondissement (near the Latin Quarter.) Rooms were very clean and bright, tub/shower combo was nice and spacious. L’Occitane toiletries were a nice touch. Separate toilet was ‘euro-cramped.’ Nice amenities included coffee and tea in the evening, mini refrigerator in the room and bottled water included. Small patio which is surprisingly quiet with two small tables and two chairs each for a relaxing snack on the ground floor. Everything looks like it was completely renovated recently and is a truly modern hotel. We even had a nice balcony which was perfect for an evening glass of wine. Beds were extra comfy. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful, especially Karim who was more than happy to offer suggestions for saving time and/or money. English is no problem at all and the hotel appears to cater to Americans, who comprised about 80% of the guests. Breakfast is € 12.00 pp, evening beer / wine is € 5.00 glass. Better suggestion for a more ‘authentic’ French breakfast is baguette and cheese w/ fruit, although the morning manager was a bit rude in kicking us out of the lobby area when we brought in our croissants and pain au chocolate. Said we were, “bringing our own food to the restaurant”. Hmmm…I thought they were running a hotel catering to guests, not a restaurant. We just passed it off as being old-school ‘rude French’ who hasn’t figured it out yet. The rest of the staff was great. Fairly close to the RER B subway line (7 minute walk) and the Luxembourg gardens. Same distance to the Pantheon, where we picked up our museum passes (very short ticket line.) Tips: Lots of affordable restaurants in the Latin Quarter, a favorite of many is Polidor about 10 minute walk away. Dinner for three, including starters and wine, was € 71.00 total. Bread / croissants: Go out the door, turn right and at the second street (a big street) turn left. First store on the left has fresh bread all day long. Along the way you will pass a little grocery selling fresh fruit. Cheese/etc. CremerieSte. Hyacinte. Same street as hotel, about two minutes walk (exit hotel, turn left, walk two minutes – 198 Rue St. Jacques Sweets: Regis, right next to cheese shop, 200 Rue St. Jacques Wine:Nicolas, other side of cheese shop. Quick meal: Vietnam Luxembourg, one minute past the cheese shop. Skip the one you pass on the way – not good. Snack – right out the front door, Au Vieux Cedre, Lebonese wraps. Nice extras: Free wifi which worked pretty well (sometimes bogged down when lots of people were on it). Computer in the lobby for guests to use Printer for guests use came in really helpful when work sent me an important document to review. Electronic juke box where you can select the songs playing in the foyer / tea room area (hint, it’s on the wall near where the stairs go up) Overall, would highly recommend if you can afford it. We paid € 272.00/night for two adults and one child (about US$ 350.00 / night at the time). Solid 4-star hotel. Will be happy to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Gary B.”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights from the 31st of March to the 4th of April 2012. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful - recommending and booking our evening meals for us. Our room was stylishly decorated and very clean, although on the small side. It was on the fourth floor at the back of the Hotel and was very quiet at night. The lounge area downstairs was very homely. They have an honesty bar from 6pm on an evening, which we used for pre-dinner drinks and thought this was a great idea. The hotel is in a good location, within 15 minutes walking to Notre Dame. We would certainly stay here again - and we're not easy to please!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel according to the city!”
Reviews.Author: anacattan
Reviews.Content: From the beginning the entire staff was so kind! Was a real pleasure to stay in this hotel. No doubt why all the great comments I read here to decide to stay here. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and truly stylish. The decoration is all about design, beds are comfy, toilet has great products, perfect breakfast and nothing to say about the coffee & tea available at the reception lounge that is free whenever you want. This hotel is really nice located, just few steps from RER, Luxembourg station and also, close to cluny st and odeon st. There are many interesting things to do around and good restaurants to choose. My stayed here was perfect! The best combination of great location, pleasant hotel and kind staff always considered! I would definitively choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly petit hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy F
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel with very helpful staff. Traveling with our family of 6 we stayed in the "cottage" accessed through the courtyard. That made it nice and quiet. The parents room was a decent size for Europe, and the upstairs room was a good size with a queen bed and pullout queen bed that was very comfortable for the 4 children. The children commented on the stylishness of the hotel and the room, so you know it stood out that they would even notice. A 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, and just a 3 minute walk to the RER B, made it very convenient. We chose to eat at the many coffee shops in the area for much less than the hotel breakfast. The one mishap was that they did not resupply the toilet paper, which seems strange to overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but poor sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: KerryKezbo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Le Petit Paris and upon arrival we were advised that there were no classic rooms available and they had upgraded us to a superior room free of charge which was extremely good of them. Like other reviewers have said the RER is 5 minutes walk from the hotel and it is an exceptionally good service to and from the airport. At 9.10 Euros each it’s a bargain rather than paying over 50 Euros for a taxi. The room itself is on the small side but it is Paris, we stayed in room 501 and it was on the top floor. The bathroom was beautiful and I found there was enough room to put toiletries in the bathroom and there was also a large fitted wardrobe located in the bedroom which was more than adequate for our belongings. I had previously read the TA reviews and people have stated that the mini bar is completely free. This does not seem to be the case anymore, the water is free (which is replenished daily) but the cans of soft drinks and orange juice are 3 Euros each. The hotel has feather pillows so anyone with allergies will need to request synthetic pillows, unfortunately they are extremely flat and we had a little trouble getting more than one each as apparently they had ran out. This was rectified the next day but neither my husband nor I slept very well throughout the entire holiday. The showers are fantastic and really powerful but this meant I could hear next doors shower very early in the morning and you could also hear them talking. The soundproofing on the doors/windows are very good as we did not hear any street noise but the soundproofing in the room leaves a lot to be desired. The breakfast looked absolutely terrible; considering we are in Paris I expected an array of croissants, cheese, meats, bread for a continental breakfast. There were a few bits of fruit, the smallest croissants I have ever seen which looked stale and some babybel cheese. At 12 Euro's each it was a bit of a joke. The bedroom had a small table and chair so each morning we went to the local bakery (there is one a couple of doors away and one a 5 minute walk away) and bought croissants, bread, smoked salmon (from the supermarket - located a few doors away) and cheeses from the food market located near the Eiffel Tower. As for the location, it is located close to Luxembourg gardens which are beautiful, Notre Dame is a 10 minute walk away and the Pantheon is a 5 minute walk away. We found that the nearest metro stop that takes you directly to the Eiffel tower is from Saint Michel which is near to Notre Dame (15 minute walk away). We also used this stop to get to the Champs Elysees but you have to change metro 3 times but at 1.70 euro a ticket it’s a bargain. The Latin Quarter itself was fantastic, I much preferred this area to the Eiffel Tower as I felt safe walking around the Latin Quarter at night unlike the Eiffel Tower area. One of the best restaurants is Le Petit Chatelet which is located across the road from Notre Dame (Separate review). We did find that all the restaurants we went to did not have a menu in English but it was fun trying to decipher the menus. You will find that the Latin Quarter is much cheaper than the Eiffel Tower/Champs Elysees area but the quality is still superb. The home made baguette sandwiches were 3.70 Euros each where as at the Champs Elysees it was 7 Euros for a sandwich that had seen better days. All in all the hotel is very stylish, in a good location but I feel as the sleep quality was so poor if we return to Paris we would look at staying somewhere else in the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, mainly the staff. The only remark is the rooms size...too small.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: marcy n
Reviews.Content: My husband, three teens and I stayed here three nights. This was a wonderful hotel. Spacious rooms, even the room with our three teens. Very clean, nice showers, comfortable beds, quiet. The staff were outstanding. Karim made many recommendations and bookings for us. Will definately stay here the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ab-Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Sausage66
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only has a fantastic location just 5 Min's walk to the Luxembourg RER station which is just 3 stops 10 Min's from Gard de Nord station for Euro star arrivals. Small & friendly, boutique hotel with a fantastic design in all area's. This Hotel has the WOW factor in huge quantities. Our room was on the top floor (5th) room 501 i was preparing myself for a tiny room after reading previous T.A. reviews but on arrival we were pleasantly surprised on how much space we had. The room, decor & furnishings breath quality. I have never slept in such a comfy bed before, the pillows were heavenly. We didn't have any problem connecting with the Internet. The shower was fantastic, really lovely toiletries & fluffy white towels.Cleanliness gets a 10/10. We booked through Thomas cook & received a good discount but unfortunately their room description is a little wrong, there is no espresso machine in the room, in fact this was the only thing that we missed Tea & coffee facilities in the room, but if you are desperate for a cuppa you can buy one before noon from the lounge or help yourself to free tea or coffee after noon. We did have a mini bar in the room full of soft drinks.I would definately recommend this to couples, friends & family members of ours when staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Refuge”
Reviews.Author: rewiega
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights. PROS: It was a lovely boutique hotel. Near Latin Quarters, near the RER, close walk to Notre Dame area. Nice French neighborhood, not to touristy. Loved the shower! CON: Spotty wifi in our room on the first floor, when asked what they could do, they said there was nothing they could do.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it”
Reviews.Author: Erudite13
Reviews.Content: Once again, I was guided by Tripadvisor reviews to help me decide where to stay in Paris, and I think I got it right with Le Petit Paris. The hotel name is reflective of the size of the place.....yes, as others have remarked the rooms are tres petit, but perhaps therein lies its own charm. The hotel is modern, quirky and very clean. I like the informal approach to breakfast and the lounge area at the entrance makes for a homely feel. You couldn't ask for a better location, and it's so easy to walk around everywhere. Wherever you go in the world I find it's the people that really make it what it is, and the guys in this hotel were extremely pleasant, patient and helpful....and guess what....smiley! I appreciated the way they treated me and my partner. It was Valentines and where better to go than Paris. I had the most unique Valentines Day of my entire life, mainly because of the company of a special person, but also because the hotel felt good. If you book here, you won't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the RER with poor internet connection”
Reviews.Author: liitomajava
Reviews.Content: Generally, good experience with this hotel and will recommend this place for tourist who likes to walk around the city, but not for business travellers. Pros: *Friendly and helpful staffs! *Great location, close to RER Luxembourg station *Clean rooms Cons: *Very poor internet connection, sometime WiFi signal is on sometime off. when I called the reception, I was told they can not do anything. Not recommending this hotel to the business traveller who needs stable internet connections

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: abigorange
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, funky decor, lovely, helpful staff. Just right for a weekend away. Easy to get to and from gate du nord on the eurostar. Quiet ish location, not too touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered by its Latin Quarter location, 'Starry' bathroom & Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DeeWei
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 4 nights (2nd half of our honeymoon) in March 2011 and we still have fond memories of our time here. Watching the movie “Midnight in Paris” recently on cable TV was the push I needed to post my review. The strength of this hotel lies in its location in the heart of the Latin Quarter plus its top-notch customer service. Location Hotel Le Petit Paris is situated in the fringes of the 5th Arrondissement @ Rue Saint Jacques. What I loved about its location was its proximity to the ‘Jardin du Luxembourg’ (Luxembourg Gardens – it’s in the 6th Arrondissement) and of course the short walk (?2 minutes) to the Luxembourg RER station. We were literally surrounded by food – so many cafes, brasseries etc at traveler-friendly prices. Daytime, hubby and I love walking thru Jardin Luxembourg in the mornings after breakfast – seeing the perfectly maintained French gardens, kids with their sailboats or playing in the sandboxes and admiring the lovely La Fontaine de Medicis. At night, the adjacent streets are indeed ‘made for walking’ – there is nothing quite like strolling past the historical ‘Pantheon’ under the glow of the moonlight. External Façade The white walled Hotel Le Petit Paris began as an 18th century coaching inn tucked inside the ancient city walls of Paris and has more or less preserved its external façade thru the test of time. Room Interiorly Hotel Le Petit Paris is a boutique 5-storey hotel with 20 uniquely designed rooms. Hubby and I stayed in a “Superior Room” - it’s an 18m2 room with a queen-sized bed. Rather cramped admittedly but then that’s the norm in Paris. The room was clean and had a modern design. Our room was done up in greenish and yellowish hues with a painting of the Eiffel Tower by the side of our bed. Wi-fi connection was speedy and the best feature of all was its ‘romantic’ bathroom. The bathroom was equipped with an adequately sized bathtub + shower overlooking ‘starry lights’ tile ceiling and we felt pampered with the L’Occitane toiletries. Our gripe about the bathroom however would be its leakage problem but thankfully we had adequately thick towels to mop it up. Breakfast We didn’t try their breakfast because as mentioned earlier, Hotel Le Petit Paris is surrounded by food. =) Service Two thumbs up for the hospitality shown by the hotel staff. They were courteous, professional and spoke fluent English. They really went out of their way with helpful recommendations of restaurants and tour bookings. A notable point to mention about the hotel is the complimentary tea/coffee and tidbits in the reception area and the free wi-fi + free printing service (comes in handy for printing out online airline ticket bookings). This is indeed a gem of a hotel which lives up to its Travellers' Choice Hotel Awards 2012 Top 25 hotels in France (#5) and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: tmg1958
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is near the Sorbonne in the Latin quarter. The hotel was recently renovated and looked new. The staff was outstanding...friendly and helpful. The breakfast was typical french...light and just enough to get your day started. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. If your not use to European style rooms you might be suprised by the size. The basic room is small by American standards but functional...The larger rooms are great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone based on location,service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel-but it is "petit"”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Gamble
Reviews.Content: I recently had a great four night stay here and would highly recommend this hotel. But be aware of a few things up front: It does indeed live up to it's name as the "Petit" Hotel. I've stayed in many European hotels and this was, by far, the smallest room I've ever experienced. We chose a "classic" room and we struggled to fit suitcases for both me and my husband in the room. If you are travelling with two or more people, choose one of the choices other than the "classic" room because it really is only big enough for one person. That said, if you can get past the room size, it's a great place to stay. The location is perfect. Close to all the sites and two blocks from shops and a wide selection of restaurants. The rooms and the hotel overall have some really fun, modern decor. The rooms are very clean. The bed are exceptionally comfortable and the bathrooms have awesome "rain showers". The breakfast is an extra 12 euros but is very good. Wonderful French coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice (best I've had outside Florida) and a good selection of fruit, breads and yogurt. The best part of the hotel was the staff. They all speak very good English and are exceptionally helpful and friendly with restaurant recommendations and tour bookings. We also had no issues leaving our large luggage for a two day side trip to Normandy. When we returned for our last night in Paris, the staff knew we were a little disappointed in our small room for the first few nights, so they put is in a deluxe room for the same price as the classic room. A very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura245
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate my mum's 60th Birthday. The staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcomed. The hotel is small but very cute and they do well with the space. There was 8 of us and we all loved it. We used the living room quite a lot. I broke a cup one day and a girl came straight away to clean it up without me even telling them and she did not make me feel bad or like a pain in any way. The only think i would say as Breakfast did not look like it was worth the money which is way we didn't go there for it. There were lovely places local to eat. You do need to get a tube but it is not bother. Great hotel Lovely Staff. Was perfect for us! So Thank you Hotel Le Petit. If we were in paris we would definitely go there again and we would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ClaraN
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for three nights and we had an absolutely delightful stay. Yes, the hotel room was small, but perfectly formed! It was perfect for what we needed, as we were hardly there, except to sleep, wash etc. The decor is beautiful, the shower was stunning. The staff were polite and helpful, and we enjoyed some relaxing coffees in the foyer. Would definitely recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NDale
Reviews.Content: A beautiful and charming little hotel with perfect location in Paris. It´s walking distance to all kinds of shops and restaurants, both expensive and more affordable (Boulevard St. Germain / St. Michel / rue de Rennes). It´s also walking distance to some of the major attractions and close to the metro which takes you wherever you want in Paris. The staff is incredibly friendly and very helpful. Be aware that the hotel is small, but it is part of the hotel experience at this charming place. The interior design is of the highest quality. No doubt about where to stay next time I'm going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Room”
Reviews.Author: Jlxu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Our room was on the main floor. My main complaint is my room's window that faced the courtyard area, which is also connected to the lounge/dinning area. We did not feel comfortable opening the window as there was no privacy. People enjoying a drink in the lounge was only a few meters away in plain view. The bathroom was basic. There was a rain drop shower head separated only by a shower curtain. Most of the bathroom floor was wet post showers due to the lack of structure to contain the water. The only surface besides the toilet and sink area was a small wall mount shelve above the toilet. Twice we asked for a room change but it was denied. The furniture was very beautiful, however the overall layout of this room provided no comfort. I don't remember the room number but it may have been 1.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: Swisstone7
Reviews.Content: After agonising over a huge list of potential hotels we opted for the Petit Paris largely based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews. I can see why so many reviewers have scored this hotel so highly. However I can also share some of the views of Ctephen - and for me 5/5 should be saved for only the very best - unfortunately for me Petit Paris, although very good, fell just a little short of outstanding. Firstly I should say this was our first stay in Paris so have nothing to compare to, but I agree that the rooms are small compared to what we have been used to in other destinations. We stayed in a superior room and just managed to get by, but I could imagine travellers with a suitcase each might quickly find room hard to come by. So tip one would be to travel with only one large suitcase if possible, to save on space. I would struggle to imagine how small the standard room would have been. On the plus side the decor of the room was lovely. It was spotless, modern and tasteful. Basically the images on the hotel website were exactly as the room itself so if you like what you see then you should not be disappointed. (our room was the red decor) The real highlight was the bathroom - great design (you could shower in the dark if you wished as small lights within the tiling and on the shower head provided subtle lighting effect). L'occitane products were also a great touch. Unfortuntely the shower glass guard was not properly sealed so water dripped off the side of the bath and soaked the floor. Not disaterous but inconvenient having to put towels on the floor when showering which were then too wet to use. The other small gripe was the bed. At first sight it looked huge and was very comfortable. But it soon became clear rather than a king size it was two twins pushed together. And that meant as the night went on myself and my partner found ourselves sliding into the middle, which wasn't the most comfortable. The pillows were also way too soft for our taste. Other highlights were the reception area, very wecoming, tastefully designed, and also free internet usage came in handy. Real classy / boutique style. Complimentary tea and coffee also a lovely touch. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, couldn't do enough for you. Spoke great english and gave good recommendations. Location wise its a two minute walk to the nearest RER (train station) and about 10 - 15 minute walk to the Seine / Notre Dame. We walked to the Louvre in about 30 mins. Unfortunately the weather was unbearabley cold so we didn't walk as much as we otherwise would, but definitely think in warmer weather you could reach just about any of the main attractions on foot, perhaps apart from the likes of Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations meets Bleak House”
Reviews.Author: Ctephen
Reviews.Content: It says much about the general standard of Parisian hotels that this establishment rates so highly on Tripadvisor. The place is perfectly adequate - great location, helpful staff and clean - but garish colour schemes and a Nespresso machine do not a top-notch boutique hotel make. The room I had (a grade up from standard) was small to the point of claustrophobic. If I'd been sharing it would have been totally unbearable. The bathroom and loo are squeezed in to such small places it necessarily means they are basic and cramped. Facilities are generally basic, including a room service menu that seems like a grudging afterthought. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad...but I'd expect more for £250 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great people- lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Renaissancewendy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews. It did not disappoint. Was on business and stayed only one night (too bad for me!). The room was small, but adequate. Decorating fun and interesting. Comfortable bed, excellent sheet and pillows. My room faced the courtyard, so very quiet and I could sleep with the window open, which I love even in the dead of winter. Service was excellent. I was lucky enough to be given a tour of some of the other rooms. All were very nice. There was no work desk, which could be an issue for some, but a minor inconvenience. Thank you for free wifi- my pet peeves when traveling for business. Great neighborhood. I travel a lot and have been in many hotels in Paris. This is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomormrod
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel... The 5th and 6th are my favourite locations in Paris for a quick getaway. The only problem is that St Germain can become quite touristy (I am fully aware that i am part of the problem!). Le Petit Paris is just off of St Germain about 0.5 miles up rue St Jacques. Perfect walking distance to St Germain, the Pantheon, Jardin Luxembourg, Notre Dame, Montparnasse, need I go on? But it is also far enough away to be in a quiet, relaxed location surrounded by very untouristy bistros and shops. Staff are extremely helpful and speak very good english, just ask them where to go nearby for a good lunch and they will point you in the right direction. Recommendation for dinner - 'Vaganende' on St Germain... walking distance from hotel. Great Belle Epoque style classic French dining. Rooms are small, but this is Paris and that tends to be what you get... they are however very comfortable and the bed is great. Go for it

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sillymango
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel!! We stayed for 3 nights in June 2011. Clean and very cute. Loved that they had a nespresso machine in the lobby for guests. Service was great! Staff was very helpful with directions and spoke English. Room size is fairly large for nicer hotels in France - not tons of space, but big enough for your stuff! Bathroom was very nice and the overhead rain shower was a treat! Would go back here again without any hesitation! Convenient location - close enough to the train and restaurants, but not noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mareila M
Reviews.Content: The best in Paris. I love the service that my friends and I got from the booking to the very last day. Just great service. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it too”
Reviews.Author: Rhetor
Reviews.Content: The Petit Paris is certainly as good as the recent reviews suggest. On a previous visit to Paris we found ourselves lost and stopped in the hotel to ask directions. Although we weren’t guests the woman at the desk was extremely helpful and even left the reception desk to point us in the right direction. We decided that we would try the Petit Paris on our next trip to Paris and we are very glad we did. The rooms are well designed and well furnished. Ours had a terrific walk-in shower that has led me to re-evaluate my opinion of French plumbing. The bathroom also had tiny LED light imbedded in the tile which gave a delightful glow to the room. The service was friendly and efficient—both Alexandra and Benjamin the front desk were terrific. My only reservation about the hotel is location. It is close to the Jardin du Luxembourg and the Pantheon, so it is certainly not a bad location. The immediate surroundings on the rue St. Jacques are nondescript, however. My wife and I have a slight preference for other Left Bank neighborhoods (Montparnasse and St. Germain). But if you want to be in the Latin Quarter the Petit Paris is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!”
Reviews.Author: inthelooper
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, helpful, and speak English. The hotel decor is gorgeous and I love the boutique feel. Also, they have an honor bar with wine/beer/coffee you just help yourself and write down your room #. Located across from Jardin de Luxemburg and strolling distance to all the sites and is a great base to explore from. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackiesd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights and then returned for 2 additional nights over the Christmas holiday. The hotel, location, the rooms (103 & 102), and the cleanliness were all fantastic. We loved the decor and the deep bath tub, not to mention the sparkly lights in the bathroom tiles! The location was quiet, yet 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro and 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame. We cannot say enough about the staff. They were exceptional and went above and beyond helping us make dinner reservations, arranging cars to and from the airport, and even storing our large suitcases while we went to the countryside! Alexandra, Karim, and Benjamin were so helpful and friendly and really helped make our trip outstanding. We will stay here again and will definitely recommend this fantastic hotel to anyone planning a stay in Paris. Thank you so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Love It”
Reviews.Author: Gillian H
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay with the hotel for 6 nights this early December. The staff were helpful, the room was tastefully designed and very clean, the location was excellent (walking distance to Luxembourg Garden and St. Germaine and eateries are everywhere). Lovely little hotel, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sammimarie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and were NOT disappointed! In fact, this was one of our most enjoyable hotel stays! The staff were absolutely wonderful - Alexandra and Karim were extremely helpful and spot on with all recommendations. Our room was lovely - yes the shower leaked but we had plenty of thirsty towels to soak up the water so i twas not a problem. The bed was so comfortable and there was sufficient space for our luggage. I cannot say enough about the location! We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go including the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. We were just a few minutes walk from Notre Dame and Saint Chappelle and close to wonderful restaurants and of course the Luxembourg Gardens. If you want a friendly bar to watch an American football game, go to Wide Open Spaces a block away for a warm welcome and a cold beer.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great location and a very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Emmakristin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend just before christmas and had a great time. The room was not very big, but had all the facilities we could need, and especially the bathroom was great and gave the whole room a nice luxurious feeling. Great location! The staff was very helpful both with great tips and reservations etc. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a great service attitude!”
Reviews.Author: Luigi715
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel in an excellent location. Stylish and comfortable furnishings; homely feeling; clean and in a quiet area. Front desk staff (Alexandra and Karim) are extremely helpful and very pleasant in all respects. The free access to the Nespresso machine is a great idea. Would definitively return. Luigi & Lucy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location!”
Reviews.Author: istrumistabali
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect , very central close to subway (1min walking), Pantheon (2 min), NotreDame (10 min) , Marais(20 min) ...and so on. The staff is friendly , the rooms are small " like the name suggests" but very comfortable .

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Saratogajh
Reviews.Content: We just completed our third visit to Paris. We chose Hotel le Petit based on tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is recently renovated. Our room was spacious by Paris standards and spotless. Bed was comfortable. Location excellent only 3 blocks from Luxembourg RER. Coffee service available. Minimal street noise. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: Helena V
Reviews.Content: Location was great in the Latin Quatier, close to Luxembourg station. The staff was excellent and really service oriented. Felt welcomed immediately. The staff very kindly gave advice for dining and booked also tables. Clean, quiet and beautifully designed hotel with L'Occitane toiletries. Due to my allergies they changed duves and blankets to non-feather ones and cleaner did not use any strong scents. Excellent stay, loved every minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “A true boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABrasil
Reviews.Content: We took a DE LUXE room, at the back of the property ( 280 EURO$ ). Confortable ( for Paris standards ), with L'OCCITANE amenities at the bathroom. Very clean and amazingly quiet. Five minutes walk from Jardin de Luxembourg ( RER ), and Pantheon, and very close to a number of restaurants and cafes. Le Perroudin, an ancient bistro, was indicated by the hotel, and it was realy good, at a razonable price ( aroud 50 EURO$ p.p., wine included ). Friendly staff, good breakfast... everything was just fine. Would certainly saty there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMount-travellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this lovely boutique hotel late May, 2011. On arrival we were met by very pleasant and welcoming staff. The lounge/breakfast room on the ground floor decor is contemporary and very relaxing, with tea and coffee available, which we found very refreshing after returning to the hotel from a very busy day sightseeing! Although our room was on the small side it was quiet, spotlessly clean and comfortable, and had everything we required including a small table and 2 comfortable armchairs, the bed was very comfortable with lovely clean, crisp linen. The en suite was a nice size, which included a full bath with shower, with lovely toiletries! The toilet was separate from the bathroom, a big plus. Another big plus was the air-conditioning, it was very hot in Paris during our stay, and returning to a beautifully cool room was a pleasure not to be taken for granted in Paris!! Breakfast was fresh and plentiful, with fruit, cereal, yogurt, toast and tea or coffee. The Hotel is located near The Luxembourg Gardens and is handy to the RER, with excellent restaurants and bistros within walking distance – ask reception for their recommendations. We highly recommend Hotel Le Petite Paris and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good, with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: littlemissredsoles
Reviews.Content: Normally stay in hotels near the Louvre when in Paris, but decided to stay at Hotel le Petit Paris due to the great Trip Advisor reviews. All in all a great place to stay, though there were a few issues. The Good: 1) Great location in terms of getting to the hotel from the airport. You can catch the RER to Luxembourg from the airport and then walk to the hotel. Note there is an escalator going up to the street, but not one down, which can be tricky for returning to the airport with your luggage. I caught a taxi back and that was easily arranged by the hotel. 2) Great location in terms of sights. I saw a lot of things I probably wouldn't have seen but for staying at the Hotel Le Petit Paris. Luxembourg Gardens is just around the corner. You can catch the RER at Luxembourg or walk to a lot of different places - I walked to and from the Musee d'Orsay one morning. 3) The room itself was small, but that wasn't a problem for one person, although it might be worth going up to the next level of room for 2 people. The bathroom with shower and sink was quite reasonably sized, there was a separate toilet, and then the double bed which had two slim wardrobes next to it - one with the fridge, which featured complimentary beverages. Note though that only the water, not the soft drinks, are restocked during your stay. There is free wi-fi during your visit as well. 4) The lobby areas really exemplify the funkiness of the hotel. Great but functional places to sit and relax. I spent an afternoon working on my laptop in the lobby area - which also functions as the breakfast room - and that was no problem with the staff. You can also sit and read, or hang out and enjoy the Honour bar. Bad: 1) When I checked in, but notified that my room wasn't ready yet - I was there at 1 and the room would be ready at 3. But when I came back at 3 and was told that there was a problem with my room - it had not been prepared for an arrival, and so it would be another hour before it was ready. This struck me as unusual as there are not many rooms in the hotel, so wouldn't expect this to happen. 2) On my second day, I left my room early - about 8am - to go to Versailles, where I got caught in a torrential rainstorm and decided to come back to the hotel early, as being soaked for two hours left me feeling quite sick. I got back to my room at 1pm but it hadn't been serviced. I got into bed and received a phone call at 3 asking if they could service my room. I explained that I felt very unwell and couldn't leave my room right now, but if I could have some towels brought in that would be good. The maid came to my room and seemed very upset and flustered that the room couldn't be cleaned, rushing around and trying to do a full clean in 3 minutes. I felt that the fact I was unwell should have been more important than the room being cleaned, particularly even given it was my decision not to have the room cleaned. However, on the next two days the room was cleaned quite early in the day, which was very useful. Overall, it was a good hotel and I would recommend it, it has a great location, though I'm not sure if it would be my first choice on a return visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but Cosy Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LS641
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, extremely helpfull staff who are more than happy to assist with local resturants, taxis, maps etc. On arrival we were upgraded to a Deluxe room, originally booked a Superior so this was a lovely surprise. Room was very comfy and not at all noisy, it was on the 5th floor and over looked the rooftops of Paris with the Eiffel Tower in the distance on a clear day!! The tea & coffee facilities in the hotel lobby are a nice touch and make it feel like home. After 6pm they have an honesty bar which is great when returning after a long day of sight seeing! We loved our time in Paris and the hotel topped it off. We cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DazzaTri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife when I raced in the Chateau Chantilly Triathlon. The staff were really helpful with directions to anywhere that we wanted to and even got up in what seemed the middle of the night to help with my breakfast, including giving me access to the kitchen! It's a great location for sightseeing too as you are round the corner from the Metro and a few minutes walk from the Pantheon and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to this gem”
Reviews.Author: escapeeCambridge
Reviews.Content: Returning to this boutique hotel having first visited when it had just opened 2 years ago, I was very pleased to see that the standard of both the accommodation and the service had not dropped in any way at all. The staff were, without exception, friendly, helpful and patient with all our requests however peculiar! They answered all our endless questions, made meal reservations for us, looked up obscure addresses, printed off maps and routes etc etc whilst at the same time providing us with as much tea, coffee, water and soft drinks as we could consume - all free of charge. Little touches such as this make a stay that bit more enjoyable. After a long day's walking, returning to the comfortable lobby of le Petit Paris for tea (or a glass of wine from the honesty bar) is like coming home. The individually decorated rooms are quirky and comfortable and it is very quiet for such a convenient location - Notre Dame 8 mins walk away and plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. We will certainly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good things in small packages”
Reviews.Author: chef_andrew1
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Paris in 30 years and my wife had never been to Europe at all, so we did a fair amount of research for our trip. We saw the reviews for Hotel le Petit Paris, and we were delighted we could get reservations. We were there for four nights... The reviews were pretty spot on... The location is what really brings it home; all the energy of the Latin Quarter, just steps from Jardin Luxembourg, walkable to just about everything... We really enjoyed walking to and from dinner every night - sometimes a pretty good distance, but in Paris nothing could be more beautiful. We never once felt even the slightest concern about walking around late at night in Paris. It is indeed small... standing in one spot on our floor's landing area I could touch all four guestroom doors and the elevator without moving my feet, and the front desk is truly a just a desk sitting in a small area just inside the front door, but it's not the size of the desk, it's who's sitting behind it that makes all the difference. The staff (the one person at the desk serves as both check-in and concierge) was exceptional, from setting up reservations (we made them well before we arrived for dinners - all handled via e-mails to the staff), to marking up maps for our walks and Metro adventures, to reccomending cafe's and patisseries. I cannot say enough about how gracious and helpful the desk team was. The rooms too, were typically small, but very inviting. We had a Double Deluxe room with french windows that opened overlooking the rooftops. We sat with the widows open wide in the afternoon at our little table with a half bottle of wine (available during the afternoons in the lobby for a quite reasonable price) and watched the sun go down. The shower was great, the bed was extremely plush, noise not a factor at all. As in most hotels in Paris, you have to be moderately crazy if you take the hotel breakfast (usually 12-18 Euros per person), when you can get up and walk a block to patisseries, boulangeries, or street crepe makers for an amazing and inexpensive breakfast... One of us would go out hunting and gathering, one would go to the lobby for coffee, and a few minutes later we'd be back in front of those open windows in our room eating things that would make a foodie weep. This is a very new conversion, so it's still nice and shiny at this point - hopefully it will stay that way. Do not freak out (as I did) if you go to the address on Google street view. The shot was taken before it was purchased for conversion, but not knowing that info, it sent me into a vortex of panic. It's really there and it's fine and pretty and funky-cool in it's design. We will definately return here when we next visit. You can check out my other reviews of Paris restaurants and other activites by clicking on me.

Reviews.Title: “small but delightfully formed”
Reviews.Author: JulieMooney
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights in Hotel Le Petit Paris and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Our room was on the small side but that I believe is virtually universal in Paris hotels and perfectly adequate for a short stay. The space available was utilised optimally and thus the room didn't feel cramped in any way. Our bed was comfortable and fitted with quality linen.The space in the public areas was also very well used to provide a welcoming space to have breakfast, a coffee or a drink. The staff were helpful, professional and spoke excellent English. Our room was in the small annexe at the back of the hotel so we had no road noise at all, on the contrary it was very quiet. Finally we really liked the location. It was an easy walk to many attractions including Notre Dame, Louvre, Musee D' Orsay. It is extremely convenient in terms of access to the airport, it being a 35 minute RER journey followed by couple of minutes walk from the Luxembourg RER station. There are also more than enough quality restaurants and bistros in the area I really can't find anything bad to say about this place! well worth a stay

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahbaggins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter, close to Notre Dame. The bed was comfortable and the room was on the small size but not uncomfortable. Coffee was free in the afternoons/evenings and in the room there was free soda/water bar (though they forgot to refill the soda the last 2 days we were there). The bath room was pretty but we couldn’t take a shower without water running all over the floor as the shower glass didn’t cover enough. The Staff was very friendly and spoke many languages. The breakfast was a little expensive for what you got so we went out every day. There was a party across the street one night and I thought they were in the room with us but that is not really the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Swannies14
Reviews.Content: Was just perfect for our first visit to Paris. Scott and Belinda

Reviews.Title: “Small but well located”
Reviews.Author: brianjm52
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night before flying to Switzerland at the end of our France holiday, but well presented boutique hotel in the latin quarter, Small room "petit" but friendly helpful staff and location make up for the small room size

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Scott O
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Paris for 5 days and had a wonderful time. Our incredible experience was due, in no small part, to the exquisite Hotel le Petit Paris and the staff. The Hotel itself is just stunning in its' decor, clean and comfortable, and in a great location. Our room was beautiful, filled with touches of elegance. The bed was so comfortable that we decided to forego the usual wake-up calls while on vacation and just wake up naturally. The staff at Hotel le Petit could not have been nicer. They were very accomodating (they speak several languages fluently) and made us feel like we were part of their wonderful city. All the restaurant recommendations were perfect and any time we had questions about getting around town, they were more than happy to assist us, even printing maps for us to the particular location. We can not wait to go back to Paris and we see no reason to stay anywhere else but this hotel. THANK YOU TO EVERYONE THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: The_Irish_Guys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights recently on a weekend visit to Paris. The hotel is in a very good location in the Latin Quarter just off Boulevard Saint Michel and a few minutes walk from the Sorbonne and Notre Dame. There are lots of cosy bars and bistros in the surrounding area. The hotel rooms were designed to represent several different eras. We stayed in the Louis XV room and while in common with many Parisienne hotels the rooms were quite small, they were beautifully decorated. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were outstanding. Hotel staff were first class and made dinner reservations for us on two of the nights. Overall a very good experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joel G
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on an exhaustive search of the internet and Trip Advisor. We had never been to Paris before, but have many friends and family who had. They all had their own suggestions for the best area of the city to stay in. We chose Le Petit Paris partly because we thought it would be well located for our visit and what we wanted to accomplish during our visit. The hotel staff is extremely professional. The website is top notch and the responsiveness to our emails before the trip was better than almost all US Hotels I've stayed at. We stayed in Paris for 8 nights and had planned to split our time between two different hotels in two separate parts of the city. One on the Left Bank and one on the Right Bank. We decided at the end to just stay in this hotel for the entire visit since we thought it would make our trip so much easier, knowing that we had our little Paris "room" to come back to in the late afternoon or evening. In terms of location, I would say that it would have been easier to have been a bit closer to Saint Germain or in the direction of the Seine/Notre Dame/St. Michel. It would have saved 10 minutes of walking to the St Germain restaurants and shops each day. Since we were staying for 8 nights we knew that we would have plenty of time to visit all of the main sites. The hotel is close to the Luxemburg RER (subway) station and so you can access all of Paris so easily by the Metro or Bus. We took the RER B train straight from the Airport to the Hotel and saved around 40 Euro. It was an easy transfer to the train to the Versailles and Fontainebleu castles (the later a highly recommended day trip) The hotel room is very beautifully decorated with a lot of attention to detail. The bathroom had a fantastic shower and lighting. Reminded me a bit of staying at an Aloft hotel in the US. The beds were very comfortable. Our only issue was that the blankets/quilts were quite heavy and it got hot at night. Each room has an air conditioner, but the hotel limited the thermostat to how cool you can make the room (This was a bit bothersome as it could get quite warm with the heavy blankets). Just a small note - the beds have a pretty mini bedspread. The maid staff though did not make up the beds with it every day and just folded them in the corner. (this is a small item, but for an expensive hotel that prides itself on the small details it's something that they should make note of). They also limited the volume of the television which was somewhat inconvenient depending on the channel and program you were watching. It was nice to have the stocked (free) mini refrigerator and the safe in the room. The maids restocked the fridge everyday, although we did have to remind the staff twice to restock. (again a small annoyance that seemed out of place for an upscale boutique hotel). The hotel concierge staff was awesome. Very fluent in English and willing and able to help with all of our requests. Overall, the hotel is very well run and was a great part of our vacation in Paris but is probably 20% overpriced based on the location and size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “location not quite ideal”
Reviews.Author: Sam7506
Reviews.Content: a nice and boutique style hotel, with friendly, helpful, multilingual staff. As we preferred to explore the surrounding cafes for breakfast, I don't know about the quality of the breakfast. Front Desk staff was very good throughout the stay. Room was tiny and not very exciting, but the shower was great. Spacious and very interesting lighting in there - that was cool. The location though was not as ideal as pictured. There are more hotels in significantly more vibrant parts in this part of town, whilst it always took us quite a walk to get to restaurants, pubs, cafes etc. - In general a nice place, but for location, I would not pick it again.

Reviews.Title: “An Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: besterCY
Reviews.Content: The hotel le Petit Pari was choosen based on the reviews in tripadvisor. The location of the hotel is very good. It's near Luxembourg Gardens, the Quartier Latin and the Panthéon, Saint Germain des Prés and Notre Dame Cathedral. We booked a Superior room, it was a bit small, but the bathroom was spacious. It had free WiFi and free drinks in the room. The staff was very helpful whenever we needed them. We really enjoy our stay! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel. Felt like a glamorous home.”
Reviews.Author: WeebersTravels
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for its design, personal feel, location (it felt safe and typically Parisian), service (friendly & helpful-in Paris even!). Petit Paris Hotel feels more like a glamorous townhouse home from home (of my dreams!) than a hotel. Complete with good looking staff who were more like friends looking after you brilliantly (they recommended places, made bookings on my behalf and provided a map) but yet not in your face. There’s a decent honesty bar with complimentary snacks, proper glass Evian bottles and a Nespresso coffee machine. There’s complimentary wi-fi throughout, a guest lap top and guest parasols at your disposal in the ultra cool 'livingroom'. The gorgeous bedrooms provide you with goodies such as: complimentary water & soft drinks (you arrive parched off the Eurostar to this fridge and life feels good again), L'Occitane goodies, comfy bed (2 pillows as standard!), selection of lighting options (bright, dimmed, side, optic sparkles etc), shower options (rain forest and hand held), the tall French windows with Juliet balcony. Yes, it's compact but that's Paris. Space in the city is kept for the elaborate gardens and quaint streets. There is a Velib bike (Paris answer to Borris Bikes) station about 100 yards away. Just for a weekend I escaped to a Parisian chic townhouse & toured about on my Velib (bike) feeling like a privileged local. Made my weekend. Brilliant stay. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here a week and enjoyed it very much.”
Reviews.Author: Arlene L
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are not large (we had a superior double) they are very well appointed and extremely well maintainded. I was told the hotel is only two years old, so everything is very fresh. Excellent bed, first rate linens and terrific bathroom. Very modern design. We decided to pay 12 euros each for 'continental breakfast,' which consisted of a hot beverage, fresh squeezed juices, lots of fruit, a variety of breads and pastries, cereals, yogurt and more. Given the prices in Paris, we decided this was a good deal and provided a very pleasant start to the day in the hotel's chic little breakfast area. Other nice touches were a complimentary assortment of waters, juices and beverages in the minibar of the room. (And the maid replenished this everyday for us.) Also, free coffee and tea service in the lobby lounge all afternoon and evening. Also a computer and free Internet service. Nice touches that made you feel that you weren't being ''nickled and dimed to death" for every fee that other hotels try to extract from you. The staff was excellent and we frequently consulted with them on restaurants and directions. I also enjoyed the location in the Luxembourg area. Very convenient by foot or Metro, but still quiet and with a wide assortment of restaurants on the streets surrounding. If you choose to stay there, make sure you stop in the Luxembourg Gardens, only two bloock from the hotel. Breathtakingly beautiful and serene.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherine G
Reviews.Content: Our extremely positive experience began even before we arrived with helpful correspondence from the hotel team. Every member of the staff was gracious and helpful upon our arrival and throughout the 5 nights we spent in Paris. Our superior room was attractive and meticulously clean. It was small - we knew this in advance as square meters were posted on the website - but the use of space was well thought out. The bed was very comfortable, and the shower was great. Worth the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!!”
Reviews.Author: mrvine
Reviews.Content: A fantastic boutique hotel in a good location, just around the corner from the Pantheon and close to the lovely Luxembourg Gardens. The staff were very friendly and would help with any request we had. The rooms were tatsefully decorated and the communal areas of the hotel were first class and provided a great base for our stay. We stayed in August 2011 and althought the weather tried to spoil our trip the hotel certainly helped to make it. Rooms not big but very clean and tidy and presented without fault. The breakfast was very good and provided us with a good continental start to the day. The staff booked a dinner cruise for us one evening and it was all sorted with no problems, we just had to turn up and enjoy it, which we did! Fantastic hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lilliputian, but oh so cute”
Reviews.Author: MommyG60
Reviews.Content: We managed to snag a two night reservation at this gem. We had found it via Tripadvisor. We had booked into a Local Holiday Inn that turned out to be a nasty dump, and were near tears of joy when we found le Petit Paris. Unfortunately, our room - the only one available - was extremely tiny, although being a Deluxe Double. The bathroom fit one person at a time, there was no place for a toilet paper holder, so the roll stood on the floor. But, the shower is very snazzy, the amenities are L'Occitane, and there's no place to hang up a towel. Nor to put toiletries anywhere but on a small shelf. The bed was perfect, and a one-piece mattress. The closets were broom closets. The TV stood on the floor for lack of a place to put it. The decor is all trendy and hip, but also there's lots of steel, i.e. sharp corners to bump into, like the whole place was designed by an interior decorator who has read too many articles about W hotels, and has no clue about comfort What else? Breakfast was very good, with eggs made to order. Soothing, jazzy music. A lovely little courtyard to sit in and have your (free) espresso (and right across the street is a wonderful small Belgian chocolate shop). An Honor Bar in the evening! Alexandra at Reception is a gem! Altogether, I would only come back if I could have a larger room, such as perhaps the one they set aside for families. But it was an experience and we're glad we came across this tiny hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A delight at every turn...”
Reviews.Author: xaisywoman
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered this lovely hotel, I was treated like gold by the helpful staff (unfortunately I have forgotten the name of the incredibly handsome young man who made me feel very welcome and assisted me wherever possible). I was fortunate to be upgraded to a Deluxe room and if I were to return I would definitely pay the extra to secure this standard of room. It was gorgeous and I could even see about a third of the Eiffel tower! For my first time in Paris this made it so special. I cannnot fault the room and was exactly to my taste, fluffy robes, slippers, comfortable bed linen - and the bathroom with the inset lights in the shower was magical. I was on my own but didn't feel lonely at all. I am usually a room service breakfast kind of person (to spare everyone my hideous morning face!) but I made the exception to enjoy the wonderful ambience of the cute breakfast room - everything was absolutely delicious and reasonably priced - freshly squeezed orange juice was such a nice touch. I appreciated the location and was able to walk everywhere - even to the Eiffel Tower which seemed to be quite a distance away. I will definitely return with my daughter next year. Thank you to the staff for making it easy by speaking to me in English and being so helpful - if only I could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kelfon
Reviews.Content: Awsome place to stay because there was so much to see and eat around this hotel. What surprised me was how near by some good restaurantsare, the Tibet restaurant near by (Kondoor) the steam dumplings were delicious, walked down to the Rue Moufetard which had some great little cafe's and restaurants, patisseries and fresh fruit shops. You can swing by Place Monage on the way back and walk around the little "farmer"s market. some amazing cheeses. From the hotel you can walk up to a restaurant on Estrapade street called L'Estrapade (excuse my French and lack of details since I am currently in Nice having only left yesterday and typing on la ipad.) who's French cuisine is amazing, great fois gras and pigeon, as well you get a home feel when you eat there. The owner has a Bernaise background and likes to tell you about it, Cooper the dog is always hanging around you trying to coax customers to feed him (don't feed the dog) and portions are big. You can also walk up Saint Michel ( or Saint Jaques but more to see on Michel) and when you reach Saint Germain St hang a right and head to another market (there is a guy who sells amazing foise gras) or head straight to the Sein and head towards Nortre Dame, or you can head to the Rue of Severin and paruse through the streets of many eats (i gave it that name, however I never ate there only with the eyes). Things to beware are the people trying to scam you by trying to get a donation from you to help with "handicap" cause by showing you a piece of paper with scribble, some lines and when all else fails they blow you a kiss. As you venture out towards more touristy places they will try the "oh i found a ring and it isn't mine you can hae it" only to come back to you and you will be obligated to give them money trick. One more thing we stayed in a delux room right next to the outside patio, only problem i have with that is i can't paruse around naked without getting dirty looks from the other customers. The hotel might want to rethink a different way of doing the blinds...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy w/ Great Metro Access”
Reviews.Author: TXgalDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: A great botique hotel with trendy features.. Best feature is the location that is walking distance to St Germain and very close to the Luxembourg Metro Station. Inside you the rooms you will find modern touches, all with their own unique style.

Reviews.Title: “okay but expected more for a top 10 hotel”
Reviews.Author: teaboston
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, 2 12 year olds, stayed at the Hotel Le Petit Paris for 3 nights before traveling to the south on a canal barge tour. Our flight was delayed from NY and we arrived shortly before 2. Although check in time is not until later, it would have been nice to get into our room and relax for a few minutes before we did the bike tour, which was fabulous! We did change and use the facilities in the basement before going on our afternoon adventure. Again, it was okay but expected more than a bathroom and a small open floor space. Upon returning that evening, our bags were in the room but the room was extremely tiny. Barely enough room to walk around the beds but the quality of everything in the room was very nice. Great colors, nice fixtures, etc. Location is great! Front staff was fine but nothing exceptional. Actually pretty plain vanilla as they were there to greet and that's about it. So, all in all, nice but I think you could do better for a top rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “C'est bon !!”
Reviews.Author: msmew8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in mid-August in a Deluxe Double room (402) with a small balcony. Let’s just say, the ‘Petit’ part of the hotel’s name was bang on! However, the room is nicely furnished with upscale fixtures and toiletries, and impeccably cleaned and stocked. The bed was super-comfortable, the shower spray powerful and relaxing, and the LED lights amusing! The room price included the small cooler of soft drinks and 2 bottles of water, which were re-stocked every day. Tea and coffee are available daily after breakfast hours are over. There is an honour bar after-hour as well. The hotel is situated in a busy side street with lots of motor traffic, but the insulated French doors reduced the noise to a barely discernible murmur. Opaque drapes also ensured a darkened room ideal for sleep. Some small negatives: not enough space to put much of anything. I had to use the bedside table to store toiletries and cosmetics. Can’t imagine if you had big suitcases to unpack! No makeup mirror; was a bit of a challenge applying makeup using a compact mirror while sitting on the bed. These were small obstacles that really didn’t impact our enjoyment of the room once solutions were found. The hotel is near the Pantheon, 2 minutes walk from Luxembourg Garden, about 20-30 minutes walk to the Louvre and the Musée d’Orsay, depending on how easily you’re distracted by the sights/sounds of Paris streets. Overall, a really good location to travel on foot if desired, and the RER is only a minute away. Convenient because travelling to and from Charles de Gaulle airport on the RER took only 45 minutes, at ~9 euros/person, and gave us a chance to take in parts of Paris we don’t always get to see. There are lots of bistros and restaurants right along the street and beyond, so eating is always a pleasure easily attained. The front desk staff was awesome! Friendly, helpful service, always with a smile. Special thanks to Alexandra and Benjamin for enhancing our Paris experience! Merci!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRobinson
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in August 2011 and it was very nice, well located and the decor was very modern. The room was small, quite tight for two people. We didn't do breakfast at the hotel but it looked good. The only small criticism I would have is that it is rather expensive for the size of the room (280 euros per night), luckily we received 3 nights for the price of 2 which made it a bit more reasonable. Apart from this it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location near Luxembourg Gardens”
Reviews.Author: BenMo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice on our trip to France, both rooms were different great with excellent decor, comfortable beds, and great lighting. Room on the 5th floor had a small balcony which was a surprise to us. Reception was great for booking reservations at local restaurants and giving recommendations for great spots to eat off the beaten path. Access to the RER/metro is close by at the Luxembourg station, allowing easy access from the airport and to get around town. No hesitation to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabiobrsp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for four days. Room was very cozy and location was very good. The taxi driver did not find the hotel so easily, and spent 10 additional minutes to find it (but did not charge us from the point he got lost). We enjoyed walking down to the Quartier Latin area (5-10 minutes) and the fact the subway station is close. Furniture in the room is very well tought and adequate for the lack of space (common in Paris), and the hotel appears to be brand new. The room had a small (really small) balcony - I always liked spending some time in the balcony in hotels in Paris... it is like being local and being part of that scenario for a while. Indeed, all reviews regarding water leaking from the shower area are true (due to lack of space, the glass dividing the shower and the rest of the bathroom is not big enough). In Paris, a very good choice for the price (stayed before in less atractive hotels paying higher prices).

Reviews.Title: “A great place and location.”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days at this hotel and were very impressed. The decor was quirky but lovely. The breakfast was delightful.The best part of our experience was the service provided by all the staff. We were recommended to try a few different activities that you would not find in your travel brochure and we thoroughly enjoyed them. A great start to our European vacation! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: delmans
Reviews.Content: This 20 room, boutique hotel in Paris is an oasis in a large city with bustling traffic and busy landmark sites. The staff cannot be more helpful and kind and when we arrived at 8:30 am after a long flight, they juggled the rooms so we could check in early and rest. Then the hostess prepared coffee and breakfast and made us feel welcome and comfortable. Although the rooms are small, each one is decorated differently and they are cheerful, bright and very clean. The bathrooms are modern, with great showers with beautiful star-like lighting set into the bathroom tile. Breakfast was continental, but for a few extra Euros, the breakfast host will make you fresh scrambled eggs or an omelette. In the evening, drinks are available (for a fee). I enjoyed the delicious madeleines after a long day of sightseeing and they were truly delicious. This hotel is special and don't hesitate to stay here. Hurry and book. There are only 20 rooms and word is getting out!

Reviews.Title: “A great little place!”
Reviews.Author: m_17kisses
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 9 nights here in August for our Honeymoon. We had a nice clean room, it was small like everyone said but that was expected so that is not a complaint on my end. Who ever happened to be at the front desk was always helpful when ever we had questions. They clean your room every day...and really want to. We were on our honeymoon so relaxing was part of our stay and a mix of jet lag kept us in our room later in the day. Front desk will call you to ask if you want your room cleaned or anything done to the room. Even when the DND sign is on the door..and you can hear the cleaning lady because she vacuums the hall way too. So that wasn't the best..but oh well. I also remember someone leaving a review about saying you could only connect one device to their wireless. Well when we checked in they asked how many devices we had I said one. Later I remembered I could also use my phone for wireless and I went down stairs and they gladly gave me a second login for that device. They have drinks they leave in their mini bar in the room, which is not a fridge at all... We might stay here again, but if we go back I think I'll pick another area to stay in just to explore more of another area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: dubst3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room (301) for 3 nights in early July and loved it! Our room was modern, and reasonably sized based on European standards. The glass shower had LED lights in the tiles and a rain shower head - very relaxing! The room had a safe, hairdryer, and a mini bar (the water was free & replaced everyday, and I think the other items were free but were not replaced). The hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter, within walking distance to Luxembourg Gardens, many quaint shops & cafes, and some amazing restaurants. Take some time to walk around and explore the small, out of the way streets! We found a gelateria in one tiny alley (I wish I could remember the name!) that shaped the gelato into a flower on the cone - delicious & cute! Every staff member we met was friendly, and there was always someone at the front desk. We asked for help making dinner reservations and the woman called the restaurant (Le Timbre- highly recommended!) right away and got us a table. Our only complaint- when we checked in we were told that breakfast was 12 euros, but when we checked out we were asked why we didn't take advantage of breakfast since it was included in the price of our room! It was a misunderstanding - just make sure you know if breakfast is included before you miss out like we did!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm,chic decor,comfortable room, charming staff.”
Reviews.Author: cellista
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed 3 nights here in August 2011.We (and I) have stayed in a handful of other Paris hotels,but I would say this was the best by some margin. It is small,quiet(it is fair to say that we were staying in August when many local shops and bars nearby were closed,but by no means all),beautifully and quirkily decorated,very clean and with a charming front desk reception.It felt laid back but also of high standard service-wise. The lounge area includes free tea and coffee after midday,a cute outdoor courtyard,and then in the evening an honesty bar,where you serve yourself and fill out a form to charge it to your own room later. I loved the modern bathroom with its twinkly lights and the shower with option of overhead and/or handheld spray. The beds were comfortable,and the aircon perfect and easy to use.Twin beds always seem to be v narrow in hotels,but it was fine. The area is full of local individual shops,small convenience stores, bars,cafes and bistros.Luxembourg RER is close by, just a few stops to Gare du Nord.The Metro (Maubert Mutualite) is a bit more of a walk,about 15/20 mins,perhaps not one for those who don't like hills(up on the way back!) Bus no 84 to Musee d'Orsay/St Germain and Le Madeleine leaves from the Pantheon nearby. I almost wish I hadn't written this review,as I hope this hotel retains its air of a secret "little gem"!If you want large grandeur,a huge lobby and thriving bar,this won't be for you,but for comfort,style and friendliness it is superb.

Reviews.Title: “FUN little gem”
Reviews.Author: AllyBethCrane
Reviews.Content: We were in central paris, for just 2 nights and needed something with a good location. This hotel, le petit paris, was an awesome find. great service, nice cute little room, stylish furnishings, quirky elements, all added to a fun albeit short stay at this hotel. not sure how we'd take to the place if we had stayed longer but for those 2 nights, we were happy. 5 stars for this hotel and a great recommendation for a parisien hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in which we have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: JonesDD
Reviews.Content: The staff go out of their way to help guests. For example, we arrived very early and they rearranged the room of one of our party so that we could access our rooms before 3pm. The breakfast is excellent. The place is immaculately clean. It's easy to find and in a good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: Koalatree
Reviews.Content: Same thing many other people say about this hotel. . .it's nice, clean and charming. . .but VERY small. Compared with other hotels we've stayed in Europe, this was by far the smallest. Having said that, if you can get over the small room size, the place is not bad. The room decor is warm and modern, and the lobby area is nice with chairs and sofas and free. . .yes free. . .coffee, tea, and water - all pretty nice stuff too. The location is pretty good. Close to the metro, and close to many small shops and restaurants. Away from tourists for the most part. Don't expect a lot of service from this place, as there is just one person working in the front - sometimes there's a second person cleaning things up as well. So even if you wanted someone to help you with your bags, you're probably out of luck. The two ladies who did work in the lobby, however, were very friendly. Would recommend to stay here if you have the chance and are OK with the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: mothersap
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our recent stay in Paris after reading Trip Advisor reviews. Thanks Trip Advisor reviewers! Finding a reasonably priced (relatively speaking for Paris) and well located hotel in Paris is no easy feat. We loved this hotel. The room was chic, comfortable, and clean. The shower was fantastic. Location was perfect. The room was small, but not unusually so for Europe. After several disappointing hotel experiences during previous visits to Paris, this is one hotel to which I will gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Britt001
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful for our family of four. We were only a five minute walk to Jardin du Luxembourg where the kids played several times and to the metro station. Ten minutes of walking away was great shopping and eating in St. Germain--and Notre Dame. Service at the hotel was very helpful. While the suite was small (as we expected), it had all the basics we needed. Plus, the laundromat next door was very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets”
Reviews.Author: puddockStevenston
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at Le Petit Paris for a week in a superior double room. I cannot praise this hotel enough. We found all of the staff helpful and courteous. Those on reception went out of their way to help us with our queries and in booking restaurants. The room we had was, as is the norm in Paris, not huge, but it was beautifully decorated. The only drawback was the lack of wardrobe space - two females take lots on holiday. This is a very minor niggle. The bathroom was equipped with beautifully soft towels and L'Occitaine toiletries. The hotel supplied free coffee/tea/cake in the afternoons which was much appreciated on the return from a long day trip. The local area is full of eating/drinking places. There was a very good Italian restaurant next door to the hotel and across the street and down towards the Sorbonne was Le Port Salut which served excellent typical French dishes - try the duck confit - you will not be disappointed. The hotel is only about 7 minutes walk from Notre Dame and very close to the Luxembourg Gardens - beautiful to relax in. The Luxembourg Metro station is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Paris”
Reviews.Author: Belinda03
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here three for three nights. The hotel is boutique and the service exceptional. The furnishings are funky and the bed may be the most comfortable we have ever slept in! The bathroom had a rain shower with little fairy lights in the tiles. Very cool! The hotel staff were also very helpful. There is someone there 24 hours so coming home late wasn't a problem. We found that whoever was on (day time/night time) was very knowledgable and was able to suggest recommendations of attractions, shows and restaurants. Everyone staying there was really friendly which I think shows the relaxing environment that the hotel has created. The room was very quiet and the area great. Everything is in walking distance but also close to a bus line and metro which takes you directly to the Lourve so getting across town is easy! Thanks to the staff for such a memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: Gideon12345
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little hotel in a great location.
