Someone has clearly put a lot of thought into the design and for quite a decent price you get a very comfortable stay and plenty of thoughtful touches which make you immediately like the place. I had a standard superior room (303). Positives: effective (silent) aircon, free wifi, satellite TV, comfortable good sized bed, free minibar soft drinks, very clean, quiet, power shower, good towels and bathroom goods, very nice design and generously fitted out. Negatives: wifi only works for one device. Public areas are also nice but..... Upon arrival I had asked business contacts to meet me in the lobby for a short meeting. There are drinks and snacks in the lobby with little forms next to them as an honesty bar, which is quite a nice idea. I didn't see any of this as I went straight to meet my contacts as I was late. At the conclusion of my meeting they said that the hotel had a wonderful policy of free drinks in the lobby. How unusual I thought. One of them went around the corner and emerged with three glasses of champagne which we toasted with and off they went. I was then accosted by the receptionist who reminded me that this was an honesty bar (i.e. basically accusing me of being dishonest) and that I owed €36 for the three glasses!! I agreed to pay €12 for my own glass which I figured would pay their costs for all three glasses, but I was put out by the way that the receptionist accused me and just would not let it go even though it was clear that this was a misunderstanding and that €36 for regular champagne was extortionate. Anyway it didn't hugely affect my stay but being accused of dishonesty is never pleasant and I think that the idea of an honesty bar, though delightful, is just going to lead to misunderstandings. I didn't try breakfast, which was available for a €12 supplement. In summary a lovely hotel which I will be returning to and would highly recommend, but the receptionist could do with some more training...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TruTravelor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July and enjoyed it quite a bit. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They are willing to book tours for you and give recommendations (and reserve) good restaurants. The rooms are a bit small, but they are modern and equipped with nice bathrooms. The bed was very comfortable, but it only had a comforter (which I found to be fairly common in European hotels). They have free wifi service, and the room service was pretty reasonably priced. Breakfast was not included, so I didn't try it. Conveniently, there is a laundromat next door, and restaurants within walking distance. I really enjoyed it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room with balcony”
Reviews.Author: travellingworldnow
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Small private and slightly hidden amongst a series of wonderful sandstone parisian homes. The room was a great size and the chartreuse green decor was refreshing. A great bathroom with bath and TV and a very comfortable bed. We enjoyed using the balcony for drinks before going out each evening. The hotel was quiet and it was easy to get a good nights sleep, even though there are plenty of great bars and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Maesha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel le Petit Paris for a week on our honeymoon, and we could not have chosen a better place. As a first-timer to Paris, I felt that the hotel was perfect- the whole atmosphere of the place was very cute, friendly and accommodating. The location is great, very close to the RER and metro lines, with plenty of great restaurants in the area. It made it very easy to explore the Latin quarter and all of Paris. Getting there from the airport using the public transit was surprisingly easy; we just took the RER all the way to the station a block or two away from the hotel. The concierge were very nice and friendly, spoke several different languages, and were very helpful in recommending restaurants, sites to see, and overall tips for a first-timer to Paris. They have a really useful free pocket map of Paris that we could not have done without. The little outside garden and indoor lounge are lovely, especially to have breakfast or the very good free tea and madeleines they provide in. The rooms are small, as expected with a typical Parisien hotel, but what they lack for in space, they more than make up for in the luxurious towels, bed, sheets, comforters, toiletries, shower. Our shower had both a detachable shower head and a lovely, relaxing rain head, with sparkling little lights within the tiles. The decor of the room was well thought out, unique, and comfortable at the same time. Housekeeping was very good and always kept us well-stocked with free juices and water in our mini-fridge and L'Occitane toiletries. We had an amazing time here and will be staying here the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VonnieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris a few times, but this Hotel is by far the best that we have stayed at. Most Paris hotels are small, which this one is too, but what a charmer it is. Litisha on Reception was excellent and ever so friendly. The rooms are all brightly decorated, and look really good. It is also in an excellent location. We stayed with friends there, and we all truely loved it. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: MagellanEnterprises
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this rather 'mod' hotel in Paris last year and returned for three days this month. While small hotel rooms are the norm in Paris (and this is no exception) such modern comfort is unusual. Additionally, it is the welcome hospitality of the staff who man this establishment and the high standard they have maintained in the fit out that will see us return (I am sure), yet again. The availability of tea and coffee in the comfortable lounge in the afternoon, or even a champagne or cognac before dinner or bed is most welcome (run on an honesty bar basis). While our room overlooked rue Saint Jacques, it was surprisingly quiet - we even overslept a couple of times! Karim, who manned the reception over the weekend could not do enough for us and was genuinely helpful in booking restaurants, cars and even witnessed a business document that required urgent faxing home. The hotel is also in my opinion, perfectly positioned around the corner from the Luxembourg Gardens and the Pantheon, walking distance to all the other highlights, shopping, and remarkably quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: paulos1
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after reading countless reviews of the various hotels in Paris. I was very impressed with this little gem. My first introduction to Paris and really could go on for hours but the location, the staff and the rooms were all one could need so for that i sincerely thank you for making our stay so enjoyable. Best Regards, Paul and Leysa

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Curly_Armadillo
Reviews.Content: the good: location, decor, bathroom, opening windows, peace and quiet, helpful staff the not so good: hot quilts and no sheets in Summer, a bed with a pronounced slant to one side, breakfast (acceptable, not fabulous), pillows that flatten On balance, I'd stay here again though. Certainly more good than bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginauk84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located for the Luxembourg train station from the airport, for various metro stations and loads of bars and places to eat within walking distance. The hotel kindly kept our bags safe when we arrived at 10am and similarly on our day of departure they kept them till 4pm. The decor in the hotel is beautiful and the room was stunning, we asked for a room with a balcony which we were delighted with, the bedroom was a little small but fine for our 4 night stay and to be expected in Paris. Though the bathroom was a decent size. Tea and coffee was available in the lounge every day with lovely madeline cakes - mmmm. The hotel is in a fantastic location, the staff were very helpful and friendly. We didn't try breakfast as thought it a bit expensive and rather tried out local eateries!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJMelb
Reviews.Content: Well located, well appointed modern room and bathroom. Room was larger than usual for Paris standards. Staff were excellent. Very convenient to jardins de Luxembourg (our favourite gardens in Paris). Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: adamelder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days recently. It's a beautiful hotel in a great part of Paris. It is quite small and the staff are great and really helpful but there are some quirks... The rooms are small The mini-bar is not cold and only has soft drinks (it seems that they don't want you to use it as it was unplugged and the information leaflet in the room states that it is not a fridge, but it is!) There are no tea making facilities in the room but there is free coffee and tea in the lounge area In the lounge area which is tiny, by reception there are floor to ceiling shelves which you would think would be full of books and magazines to read but the shelves are stocked with only coloured boxes artfully arranged... but empty! The hotel is really clean which is nice but it gets a bit much when the hoover is on for most of the day The maid entered our room (even when we were not in) even although we had put the do not disturb sign on the door. Cleanliness seems to be almost an obsession in the hotel but there are no waste bins anywhere In our double room there was only one chair at our small table so if we wanted to sit down to have a brought in drink one of us had to sit on the bed No meals are served except for continental breakfast at a charge of 12 Euros extra per person. There is a room service menu though. But we didn't use it. It would have been too cramped in the small room for a meal to be enjoyed. The lounge area only seats 12 people max which isn't good in a 20 room hotel Our bed linen and towels were changed every day, even the towels we had not used. Not very eco-friendly. And so even though we were happy to sleep in our bed using last nights linen it was not an option. ---------------------------- In short the hotel is almost like an up-market hostel. It's a great place but has many small niggles which let it down. I wouldn't stay there again but if you can put up with the relentless cleaning regime and style-over-comfort policy it's worth a visit. For 250 euros a night I would have expected a bigger room and at least a restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Pantix
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Le Petit Paris. Staff were wonderful. Really liked the complimentary tea, coffee and biscuts in the lobby. Having the honor bar was also a nice convenience. Our room was beautifully decorated, a comfortable size, with a large bathroom. We stayed in Room #1 which we believe might be the handi-cap room as it is the only room on the first floor - very convenient for accessing the refreshments in the lobby. :-) Location was perfect. Would definitely stay here again. Tip: Have dinner just down the street at Restaurant Perraudin. We went there on our last night because it was so close and we wished we had gone earlier. It was the best meal we had! Service was great and food was so yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Style & comfort in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sydneygirl99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in May based on trip advisor reviews & were not disappointed. LOCATION It is wonderfully easy to access from CDG airport via the RER B. As mentioned by others it is in a lovely area & really easy to walk to just about anywhere which is what we did. We left from the Gare de Lyon & it was about a 10 min cab ride on a sat morning STAFF The staff are delightfully helpful & stored our bags as we arrived very early & took them to our room before our return from sightseeing. Their recommendations for local restaurants were superb & they were happy to make the reservations for us. When friends who were meeting us to go for dinner arrived they offered them complimentary nespresso coffee whilst they waited for us. They all seemed to speak good english & could not have been more helpful. ACCOMODATION As mentioned by other reviewers, the rooms are very small but stylish. We had a classique room on the 2nd floor overlooking the courtyard. If you had 2 large suitcases you would be a bit pushed for space but we were travelling light so was not a problem. We loved having a proper double bed (as opposed to 2 singles pushed together with 2 single doonas which seems common in much of Europe) & it was probably the most comfortable bed of our trip with lovely fluffy doona, great pillows & beautiful linen. The bathroom was perfect - loved the twinkly lights & big shower with good water pressure. Complimentary soft drinks & water in the room was also a nice touch EATING & DRINKING We had the breakfast both mornings & loved it. Freshly squeezed juice, beautiful fresh fruit salad, cereals, yoghurt, really fresh & delicious bread & pastries with jams, ham & cheese. My only comment is that I don't get why they don't offer the nespresso coffee for breakfast - they put that out after breakfast for complimentary use for the rest of the day & give you a flask of plunged/brewed coffee with breakfast. Contrary to other reviewers we thought the breakfast was actually quite good value for 12euros but maybe that is because of the rate of exchange with the Aussie dollar. Given that just a coffee & croissant in some cafes in Paris can cost around 6euros, the full spread for 12 seems pretty OK. The dining & lounge area is very chic & quite funky & we loved the honesty bar which was beautifully set out of an evening for you to help yourself & sit in the courtyard or in the lounge area. Gin & tonic probably a little pricey at 10 euros but as soon as we poured ourselves a drink the staff appeared with a complimentary bowl of snacks. I assume you could bring your own drinks & sit in the same area which would be smart if you were saying for longer All in all we loved this place & have already recommended it to friends we travelled with later in our trip who are returning via Paris. It is certainly not as cheap as an apartment in Paris but they often have a week minimum stay. For a stay of only a few days or simply to stay somewhere & be looked after in chic, contemporary style & in a central location I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: JAG458
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a quick 3 night paris jaunt. As the name implies, this is a small boutique hotel with small rooms which is what one expects in paris. In terms of value, I would say it was average with a modern, new, (again it is small) room with good amenities. They had a daily breakfast that we did not try (it cost extra) as we just ate at local bakeries. in terms of location, it is nicely situated near the sorbonne within walking distance of RER, metro, notre dame, etc. The service was also excellent with good restaurant recs, directions, etc. We also enjoyed the free coffee/tea/water in the afternoon/evening. Would definitely recommend for a quick trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & the staff!”
Reviews.Author: rochcitygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de le Petit in Paris last summer. It was absolutely wonderful & charming. I only say charming because the room was small, but big in European standards I hear. The entire hotel was kept meticulously clean. The staff were amazing to work with. They helped us arrange a variety of evening activities during our stay, including transportation to & from. They offered to give us "direction" if we didn't know where we wanted to head on any given day, and were very helpful in every way possible. We were at the front desk nearly every day asking questions and they were always happy to help. We felt very fortunate that they were located only a few blocks away from the RER and the Metro. There was a laundry mat just down the block as well, which was great considering we were there for 11 days. I really can't say enough about the tremendous service we received during our stay. When we return to Paris, we will definitely want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “attractive and well-locted hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMN_CA
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times, but this last vist was the first time I stayed at Le Petit Paris. I was very pleased overall. The hotel was immaculate, modern, and very comfortable. The honesty bar was a nice touch. My room (a "classic") was a bit small, but since I was on my own that didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations”
Reviews.Author: thavwplaya
Reviews.Content: We booked a double deluxe room for 4 nights. The locations is perfect. You are right at the pantheon, jardin du luxembourg, and the metro. The latin quarter is a great spot for young tourists. It also is surrounded by universities, so it doesn't have a tourist feel to it. It is very laid back, and going out to eat is cheaper. The hotel has internet, a nice bathroom, good sized bed, and a great view. Looking out our window on the top floor (5), we saw the top half of the eiffel tower. We got to watch the eiffel tower light show every night, even in lightning one night! The staff spoke many languages and had good recommendations. We didn't eat breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, 3 minute walk to the Pantheon, 10 minute walk down hill to the Notre Dame 15 minutes back….Hotel was very clean, staff was helpful but not overly friendly. Hotel has honor bar drinks are €10 each, we found it was better to buy some libations outside the hotel and use the tables in the patio area to save some €. Did not eat breakfast or take part in afternoon tea but all looked very nice. There is a very good bakery just turn left out the door for a quick fix or try Crepes a GoGo just a few steps further down St Jacques. Our room was quite, clean and very private. The only draw back was the room excellent room darkening blinds, which would allow you to sleep ‘til noon if you were not careful. Our next Paris trip will surely include the Hotel le Petit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: holidayStPeterPort
Reviews.Content: If your going to Paris you have to stay here. The accommodation is excellent, staff friendly and warm, nothing is too much trouble, your questions are answered promptly and efficiently and to top it all it's in the Latin Quatre...fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming ....”
Reviews.Author: LardB0y
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. We had a superior room, 502 on the top floor. The room was not enormous, but within expected parameters for Paris. It was very stylishly done (belle epoque style allegedly I think) and comfortable. Free wifi very welcome, as were juice and soft drinks in minibar, and Occitane toiletries. Some small glitches - a broken light fitting, and shower curtain did not really work so showering caused a large puddle to develop on bathroom floor. Staff were fantastic and welcoming at all times. Tea and coffee facilities downstairs were welcome; honesty bar a nice touch too. Breakfast was reasonable value for 12 euro - the spread was deceptively extensive and it was possible to fill up on pastries, cereal, toast , fruit and so on. Location is absolutely fabulous and atmospheric. I would not exactly describe this as a bargain - we paid 250 euro a night which is certainly not cheap. But we had a very comfortable and enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Good all the way!”
Reviews.Author: adragonne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews read here and were not disappointed. We found the hotel to be clean, neat, very nice, comfortable and with a perfect location. We stayed for 3 nights and then came back for a last night before returning home. The hotel was very easy to find coming from the airport via RER, a 5 minute walk from the station. The street itself is narrow and seemed to be noisy with bars and restaurants of all sorts. However, we had no problem with any noises a night. The hotel is a small property easy to spot. The staff was incredibly attentive in our arrival and gave us a small tour of the facilities. The hotel has at all hours a coffee and tea service free of charge and a honesty bar available in the stylish lobby. Our room was a double superior room in the 4th floor. Size was perfect, the bathroom very well appointed and everything very clean. There is a mini bar filled with juices and water that is free of charge, a very nice gesture! TV channels offer programming from across Europe. The bed was very comfortable. On our second stay (1 night) we were given a smaller double classic room smaller, but very well sized. It was an interior room but it was quieter than the other one and the view to the street is really not that good! I have nothing bad to say or to critique of this hotel it is an experience in itself and was an important element in our excellent vacations to Europe! Congrats!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel le Petit is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: RGC_2011
Reviews.Content: True to the other reviews, this hotel is great! The rooms are comfortable, nicely decorated, and spotlessly clean, the Latin Quarter location is perfect, and the staff is exceptional (Alexandra was a favorite!). My husband and I traveled with another couple who also stayed at the hotel - one of our favorite things was the hotel honor bar - a nice way to recap and end each day. The conceirge/reception staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Stay here and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: farmb0y
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in the heart of Paris. The hotel is within walking distance of many sights, shops and restaraunts. Although the rooms can be small, they are immaculately presented, very comfortable and the decor is stunning. We didn't have eat breakfast or try the room service menu. All in all highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: EandG2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptional - it was very clean, the staff were helpful, friendly and efficient. The decor throughout was modern and attractive and the room was well thought out and very comfortable. A great location - easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Pantheon and Jardin du Luxembourg. Good breakfast available as an extra and coffee available in the guest lounge in the evening and an honesty bar. A great Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: WLB77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel le Petit Paris for 4 nights for our first anniversary. It was in an absolutely perfect location (Latin Quarter, right near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Pantheon). The front desk staff was extremely accommodating, speak very good English and helped us with dinner reservations, etc. The hotel is very well appointed. We stayed in a deluxe double which was a good size for 2 people. I will say that anything smaller probably would've been a tight fit. The bathroom lights are a nice touch (starry) and our shower (room 403) was amazing. We only had breakfast there one morning but it was a good standard European breakfast and for extra euros, you can order eggs. Just so you know, this is not a value hotel. It is quite expensive, although if you book ahead of time on-line, you can get 20-30% off (which is what we did). All in all, we loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting to explore Paris on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: button2904
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy to get to - 5min walk from station: Luxembourg Station on the RER B Line Awesome location - couple of blocks from the Pantheon & a 10min walk to Notre Dame The room was "petit" but very modern and comfortable, my boyfriend & I had no problems with the size Comfortable bed Loved the L'Occitane amenities! Reception staff were always willing to help & very happy! Mini Bar in the room (free drinks) was another bonus - this was re-filled everyday Bathroom was amazing!! strong shower pressure & enjoyed the twinkling lights Fast Free WiFi Very quiet Cons: Shower leaked a little, but used the additional towels provided to soak up the water Pillows were a little too soft/flat for my liking Highly recommend this hotel for it's location & great staff. This definitely exceeded my expectations. TIP: I thought that the metro & trains in Paris were very luggage-unfriendly. So just be mindful that you may need to carry your luggage down a few set of stairs to & from the metro... The closest station, Luxembourg (RER B Line) is not one of the main stops, so for the rest of Paris, so you will definitely need to change lines/trains at least once. May be best to take the bus (faster more convenient) or for a more fun mode of transport...hire a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel in Cultural Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: PDrechsler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful 12-night stay at the Hotel Petit Paris in a deluxe 1970s style suite on the first floor of a separate cottage adjoining the courtyard. The location of the hotel in the Latin Quarter, near the Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens and Sorbonne places it in an enviable position to enjoy the café culture and shops catering to the needs of the student population and visitors. Our favourite restaurant was Les Papilles, around the corner from the hotel. It offers single four-course menu, extensive wine selection and a very cosy atmosphere. It’s best to book. The hotel, which is more like a B&B, is a short walk from the Boulevard St Germaine, River Seine and the Marais District. We walked everywhere from the hotel, and when we didn’t, found the bus transport easily accessible. The hotel itself has witnessed the hand of some talented designers. Our room and the public areas reflect edgy design, which is very pleasing (see photos). Our room was accessed by a flight of stairs from the patio, where people often had breakfast or drinks. At the time of our stay, Wi-Fi reception was very poor in our room, but OK in the lounge area next to reception. Room and bathroom (with bath) were very clean and quiet. The staff at Hotel Petit Paris made our stay all the more enjoyable because of their friendliness, professionalism and knowledge of the area. Reception staff spoke fluent English, so there were few language barriers. The person responsible for the complimentary breakfast and honesty bar deserves special praise for her politeness and welcoming nature. Altogether a truly memorable visit to Paris made even better by Le Petit Hotel Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: paddy1981
Reviews.Content: I was brought here on a surprise getaway for my 30th birthday and it was fantastic. It was very convenient to get from the airport to the hotel. A 40 minute trip on the RER B and a five minute walk from the Luxembourg stop. The room was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The bed was really comfortable. Free drinks in minibar were great. It was very easy to get a good nights sleep after busy days of sightseeing. The hotel is in a great location for places like Notre Dame and the Pantheon and a short walk to Rue des Ecoles for the 63 bus to the Eiffel Tower. Service was excellent for directions to sights and buses. Receptionist made dinner reservations for us at a nearby restaurant. Laptop available in reception for use of guests and free wireless internet all over hotel. Breakfast was delicious. Free tea and coffee downstairs is great as is the honesty bar. Will definitely return to Hotel le Petit.

Reviews.Title: “easter treat”
Reviews.Author: DevonTeaboy
Reviews.Content: took advice and used the rer b trainfrom the airport.linked to the terminal and direct line to luxembourg station.only 5 minute walk to the hotel.cost 17 euros for the two of us comparedto 60 euros in a taxi.hotel is very chic and spotless.the rooms are pretty small,but that is commonplace in paris.the bed was divine and the shower room brilliant,great powerful shower,just what you need after a long day out.nice touches with the complimentary soft drinks in room,free tea and coffee in the lounge,and honesty bar for a nightcap.the latin quarter and the marais area definitely the best,lots of affordable bars and restaurants,and the sights are just beautiful,would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: AlisonA421
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our two-day stay here. Staff friendly and helpful. Hotel facilities - honesty bar, free tea/coffee, free non-alcoholic drinks mini-bar - all excellent. Great restaurant Coup de Torchon across the road and a great patiserie nearby. Pantheon at the end of the street and Luxembourg Gardens a short walk away. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesM2805
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our break to Paris for a 30th birthday, this hotel was the first part of the trip I booked and was not disappointed. Firstly, the location is excellent. We traveled by Eurostar to Gare Du Nord and used the RER, Luxembourg stop is around the corner and the same line is direct to CDG and then most importantly you are in such a good area, the Latin Quarter to explore here and connect all over Paris easily. The receptionist at the hotel was fantastic and really made the hotel, helpful and informative we took her very passionate recommendation over the reviews on TripAdvisor and were delighted we did... she made our reservation and helped with anything we wanted. The hotel offers free wi-fi and also the use of the hotels computer, free printing and so you can do a little research before heading out over the complimentary teas and coffees. The room I chose from the pictures before we arrived, it was beautiful and though as other reviews suggest it was "petit", we knew this, and I think it was perfect, the quality of the decor all the finishing touches are flawless and compared with Italian boutique hotels (style over function) everything worked, and worked well. We will definitely return to this hotel to explore more of Paris, reassured that we don't have to worry what the accommodation will be like. The late honesty bar is a good and provides an opportunity to arrive back in the evening and relax before bed, we met some of the other guests in the hotel who were great company shared recommendations in Paris, completing an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, but the rooms are "petit"”
Reviews.Author: JJH1
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel and the staff members were very helpful. Great dinner recommendations. The place had the feel of a Bed and Breakfast. (but skip the breakfast, there are lots of choices nearby). Who could beat a spot in the Latin Quarter of Paris near the Luxenbourg Gardens. The rooms are very small, but well engineered. Pocket doors on the shower room and the toilet (seperarte from each other) made the room space more usable, but the space between the bed and the walls never exceeded 1 meter. The free tea and coffee in the lobby at night were great. Soooo... as someone who is used to big hotels and lots of perks, and rooms with lots of space, this was a big change. Still, we eneded up loving this unique spot, and even after 32 years of marriage it was a fun change that literally brought us closer together.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: sweet_candy32
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Hotel Le Petit after spending 2 days there. This hotel is very lovely and brilliant. The rooms are small but they’re well designed and comfortable. My room is decorated by the red color and grey - boutique style. The bathroom with the L'occitane toiletries and twinkling lights are amazing. It made me feel better after 8 hours flight. I absolutely like the curtain with creative and attractive patterns in my room. The bed coverings and towels were changed daily. The best thing here is the mini-bar which is always full of soft drinks. And they’re free! Moreover, in the evening, about 6pm, unlimited tea, coffee were available in the lounge area with a honesty bar. The hotel staff were so helpful, enthusiastic. There were nothing much troubles while staying here. Besides, the hotel is in a good location, it’s very easy on walking to other places such as Dame, Pantheon, Musee du Moyen Age, Jardin de Luxembourg… It was so magical to have dinner in the room which had a view of the Eifel Tower outside my window. I was totally conquered by the beauty and the convenience here. If I have a chance to come to Paris again, I will choose this hotel to enjoy the wonderful atmosphere as well as the the L'occitane toiletries again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,perfect for a Paris break with a loved one”
Reviews.Author: Covedweller
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business in France and ended up in Paris where after business my fiance came over and met for a couple of days break Very easy to find by cab from Gare du Nord and so well placed for the Sorbonne,Pantheon,Jardin du Luxembourg,Saint Germainne....etc all within walking distance Yes the hotel is small but every area of this hotel is well thought out from the honesty bar to the rooms themselves A well designed modern boutique hotel with such a welcoming feel from the front desk to the hotel staff that after a few days on business it was easy to unwind and enjoy a couple of well deserved days off The price is average for such a size hotel in Paris but the staff and hotel certainly add more to the value of a stay here The knowledgable staff can direct you to some great restaurants and you are in walking distance of some great bars and restaurants Try a restaurant called L'estrapade which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel but is very cosy serving traditional South Western French food Delicious food,great owner and a very friendly dog who'll curl up and watch you all dine

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but as the name suggests VERY PETIT!”
Reviews.Author: PalinJunior
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here following the various recommendations we have read on Trip Adviser. We stayed in a Deluxe room (402) which I believe is decked out in the style of Louis XV. The room was very clean and nicely decorated however it was very small so be warned. I did not see any of the standard rooms but I am guessing they are smaller still so not quite sure how everything would fit in! We had a 30% discount on our room and to be honest without this I would have to say it would have been quite expensive, dare I say overpriced. This is coming from someone who lives in London, but perhaps that is just Paris generally (and the terrible exchange rate at present). Whilst not a problem for me, my girlfriend did say that a dressing table and mirror would have been a welcome addition but everything else you would expect was in the room. The free mini-bar (no alcohol) was a welcome touch. We had a great balcony which unfortunately overlooked the Rue Saint Jacques (which can be quite noisy) and was in turn also overlooked by the buildings opposite so we did not spend an awful lot of time out there which was a shame as the weather was glorious. Saying that we were not disturbed at night as the doors and windows are triple glazed. We did not have breakfast but there seemed to be a good spread on offer in the morning. The honesty bar is a nice touch on an evening as is the free tea and coffee in the lounge. The staff were very friendly and helpful and could not be faulted. Overall I would say the hotel was OK but probably not to everyone’s tastes. Whilst very modern and clean I could not say that it felt particularly romantic but maybe that is just me! Great location though and within walking distance of Notre Dame and the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPBTraveller
Reviews.Content: Well situated boutique hotel on a street with several excellent restaurants and a terrific bakery down the street. The room was perfect with a beautiful bathroom and the staff was very accommodating. Arrived shortly after noon with bags in tow and was able to immediately access the room even though I hadn't made prior arrangements. A fabulous honesty bar is set up in the evening and I would go back and stay there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PDM82
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations which were already set fairly high from all the previous reviews. It couldn't be easier to reach from the airport, straight on RER B and then maximum 5 minute walk. Location is great, we were lucky to have lovely weather and so to have the luxumbourg gardens so close is a bonus. Its also a short walk to the metro, and some lovely bistro's and restaurants. We used the metro a fair bit but also managed to see a lot of the sights by foot. The hotel itself is perfect and as advertised on their website. Our room was spotlessly clean on arrival and was kept this was by the daily maid service. The staff were helpful and friendly at all times and offered advise when we asked about where was nice to eat in the area etc. The honesty bar is a great touch and we enjoyed using this before/after dinner. The decor of the hotel is immaculate and well thought out, we found our room practical as well as visually appealing. The free drinks in the mini bar is a rare find and was appreciated. Fabulous shower and ample space in the room for our suitcases. We will most definitely return and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: MillieLondon
Reviews.Content: I did like this hotel but there were a few niggles which if straightend out, could make it a fabulous hotel. The location and service were excellent. However, a previous reviewer mentioned that the shower leaked and it appears that this has not been rectified as the whole bathroom was flooded continuously when you took a shower. The lock on the bathroom door also broke so my husband was stuck in the bathroom for 20 minutes upon arriving at the hotel which wasn't ideal! Although the manager was quick to respond when I went to get him. Also, there were two single mattresses with a double sheet over the top. This was quite uncomfortable as the mattresses kept separating and moving around. We also found the breakfast to be very expensive. A much better idea is to pop along to one of the lovely patisseries and buy your breakfast there instead for a fraction of the price. It is such a shame we experienced these problems as we really had high hopes for this hotel as it has such good reviews on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing cute hotel, perfect for Paris getaway”
Reviews.Author: Austinguytexas
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Really enjoyed the room, view, and service. I would definitely stay here again. 5 star boutique property that is really perfect for a Paris Getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RCK
Reviews.Content: In the interest of brevity, I shall simply list all the things that make this hotel special and highly recommended: A great location, friendly and accommodation staff at all hours, spotless rooms, unusual and fun decor, great bathroom lighting (little LED's embedded in the tile grout), and a modern yet comfortable lobby/common area. All in a all a great experience and a perfect home base in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fashionshopgirl
Reviews.Content: Has anyone ever looked at a hotel website and thought you found the perfect place and booked it, only to be very disappointed when you arrive at the hotel. This was not the case with Hotel le Petite Paris. Hotel le Petite Paris was perfection in every way. The front dest staff Alexandra, Laetitia and Karim were amazing and extemely helpful with every request i had for them. Since my travels to Paris are work related and my comand of the French language is good but not great, having a helpful and attentive front desk is key and their was no request too large or small for these guys. Now if your a fan of contemporary design, this is the place for you. Often when a hotel goes in the direction of contemporary they lack a charm and warmth. The designers of this hotel have done a terrific job at maintaining warmth and still keeping it very cool and hip, as for my room as far as Paris rooms are concerned this room was the perfect size for one or two travelers. the decor was a lovely golden yellow and browns set against cream. I was also thrilled to see I had a view of the Eifel Tower out my window. The bed was very comfortable and after a long day of work and sight seeing it was a great place to come back to. Did I mention the bathroom? Plenty of towels, full size bath sheets, face cloths this is usally not the case in Paris hotels. This is the norm at the Hotel le Petite Paris. L'Occitane bath products were a lovely touch as well. The neighborhood embodies Paris perfection in the Latin Quater, the metro is very close by and there are a number of bistros and great ethnic restaurants right outside the front door. One in particular was a Tapas Resturant with a fun, young student vibe, simple menu and yummy sangria. The owner Tomas was the ultimate host. Nothing like the Latin Quater to make one feel very french and part of a community. With all the above being said, I have finally found my home in Paris. Hotel Le Petite Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: roothie
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this hotel. You hear so many horror stories about Paris hotels, but Le Petit Paris I cannot fault. It is only small, but so comfortable and friendly. The rooms have great decor and huge comfy beds. I loved the shower and L'Occitane toiletries. The mini-bar is full of soft drinks which are free. In the afternoon free tea and coffee can be found in the salon and in the evening an honesty bar. The location is very good. It is about 3 minutes walk to Luxembourg RER station which is just 3 stops for Gare de Nord so very covenient if arriving on Eurostar. It is within easy walking distance of a number of attractions (Notre-Dame, Pantheon, Musee du Moyen Age, Jardin de Luxembourg....). We did not have breakfast included, but there are lots of creperies, restarants and cafes nearby. I would definately recommend staying here. I'm sure i'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Gem”
Reviews.Author: Iain9
Reviews.Content: This is a small friendly hotel, boutique style, in an excellent location in the Latin Quarter with great local restaurants. The staff are all exceptionally helpful. There is a comfortable and very relaxed lounge with endless good coffee available (free) from midday. After 6pm there is an "honesty" bar to make you feel at home. The rooms are slightly on the small side. Although some just have showers some also have a bath. The rooms are well designed, with differing decor, and excellent insulation making it very quiet. there is free wifi in every room, and a laptop available for guest use in the lounge. the hotel will print for you. There is also a minibar in the room with complimentary soft drinks. Breakfast is "extra" and continental in style with good quantities of good quality food, and again very helpful staff. This is not a cheap hotel, but feels worth it. Spoil yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely lived up to the hype. Perfect for a couples getaway.”
Reviews.Author: flashg709
Reviews.Content: When I first saw the pictures on trip advisor, I thought it looked very tacky and old-fashioned. but i saw all the great reviews so thought i'd give it a try. upon arrival, i realized how wrong i was. i was thoroughly impressed with the design and attention to details. the place was gorgeous and the tackiness i originally thought was actually ultra trendy... i felt i was in an art gallery and each room has its own unique look and feel. it makes you want to check out each room. the room i wanted was not available until the second day, and the only one available on day 1 was the two-story suite. i paid significantly more, but it was definitely nice. the room i stayed in the other 3 days was also pretty amazing. i'm writing this review 6 months after my stay and my memories include: the tasty coffee in the lobby, room scent, tv in the shower, the wallpapers, and even the hotel's basement bathroom. most memorable is the awesome staff whose helpfulness seemed so sincere despite my many annoying requests and the various internet searches i had requested. note, this is no hilton or marriot with huge lobbies, conference rooms and tons of staff running around everywhere. it's a cozy boutique hotel with a lot of character. it's special and in a class of its own. also, check out the actual hotel website... the photos there seems to do it better justice.

Reviews.Title: “All rounder winner apart from one thing....”
Reviews.Author: juntun
Reviews.Content: ....we stayed at le petit paris over valentines weekend and overall were happy with our stay. The only thing we thought we should make others aware of is the room we had (classic room) was very small, as a lady I thought a bit too small for a romantic getaway :( ....also - no bubblebath - they only have showers in the classic rooms.... Other then that the service, location, decor, of room cleanliness, sleep was brilliant. Would recommend to all looking for a excellent location, luxury room in central paris, but with a warning that rooms are quite small....not the best for a romance!! Do Describe the service you experienced Tell us how you liked the room Talk about the location & amenities Say what you liked best & least

Reviews.Title: “Small, chic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FunTravel17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days before leaving for the south of France. Beautiful, small hotel with a friendly staff. Nice lobby with coffee and tea at all times; wine and snacks in the pm. The room was tiny but extremely clean and well decorated. Best of all, it was amazingly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: sahar09
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel for me as a surprise weekend as he planned to propose! The hotel was clean, well designed, gorgeous, comfortable, fantastic location, lovely service and so very romantic. Even the TV channels were good. I would recommend this to anyone for a romantic get away. P.s He did propose :)

Reviews.Title: “petit but a great location in a unique french atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: acapulco68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Petit Paris is located on rue Saint Jacques, between the Panthéon and the Luxembourg Gardens, in the heart of the Quartier Latin. This boutique hotel, a stone’s throw from Saint Germain des Prés, offers a luxurious journey back in time, an invitation to discover the history of Paris. Impeccable service ,Well-designed rooms, great location in Lower Town VIP concierge treatment i was told that during the summer of 1970 the singer Jim Morrison even stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYersLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: I loved Le Petit Paris Hotel. The staff was great and very accomodating with any question we had. Although small, the rooms were impecable and lovely. We were on the ground floor and had no problems with noise of any sort. Loved the nice touch of L'Occitane products in the bathroom. Would definitely stay here again. My husband and I found that there were tons of cafe's and restaurants near by that we didn't have to venture far out for dinners. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “"romantic boutique hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Deb071Tyne_Wear
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I decided to spend New Year in Paris and after searching on the website, this hotel kept coming up and we liked the look of it. We were not disappointed, the pictures just do not do it justice. We stayed in room 103, the Louise XV suite. The room was immaculately clean. The bed was huge and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. There was a delightful shower with gorgeous romantic lighting. There was a safe and a mini bar in the room. There was no tea and coffee making facilities but you did not need this as you could have tea and coffee in the lobby downstairs at all hours of the day. On arrival which was the 31st December 2010 (new years eve) at around 8.30 the member of staff on reception was amzing. He booked us into a fabulous restaurant two minutes down the street called Le Parraudin. Would recommend the goats cheese profiteroles. It was an absolute bargain for 3 courses at 29 euros and it was new years eve. The hotel is around the corner from the Luxembourg gardens which are worth a stroll around and the nearest metro is just around the corner Luxembourg again. Down the road about 10 mins walk is notre dame. We would definitely stay there again as the hotel had everything we wanted. Some reviews have said it is small hotel and yes it is but that it what a boutique hotel is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGFamily04
Reviews.Content: A magical Hotel with magnificent facilities and extremely helpful and knowledgeable staff. The rooms were outstanding and cleanliness was beyond reproach. The location too was excellent. We would recommend this Hotel to anyone wanting the best facilities at a decent price. We will definitely be staying there again without question. Well done to all staff and thank you for making our trip a memorable one!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at a price”
Reviews.Author: hampsterharry
Reviews.Content: Every room, including the stairs, has a wow factor in terms of the decor. It really is a very trendy hotel with excellent staff. Rooms seemed on the small size for the price. The bathroom was amazing! Our room was on the top floor, we could hear what sounded like the heating system in the background. This was slightly annoying. Overall by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in, just a shame it's pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: karenadndavidwedding
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I have just returned from a 3 night stay and were very impressed by this hotel, being a 2 min walk from Luxembourg Metro (on the line from CDG airport) the location is fantastic to explore the Latin quarter or St Germain de Pres by foot. Situated on Rue Saint Jacques which runs parallel to Boulevard Saint-Michel and is literally round the corner from The Pantheon and less than 10 mins walk to Rue Mouffetard where there are many Cafe's, Restaurants and Bars. Notre Dame and the Saint-Michel Metro are only 10 mins walk away. Rooms are petite, but beautifully decorated, very clean, new, fresh and complete with large walk in shower albeit at the expense of having a separate toliet and shower room. The reception staff are very helpful and knowledgable. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic, well located boutique hotel experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Tim4travel
Reviews.Content: Highly recommened, great hotel, superior staff, fun place in the latin quarter....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, design... will miss :)”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderGB
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING is great there, except of the street where this hotel located. I would suggest hotel owner reproduce same hotel in design and staff, just in a bit upper style area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: dany
Reviews.Content: I had the pleaseure to stay at this hotel in December. They upgraded us in a beautiful suite, plus they gave us complimentary soft drinks, complimentary tea in the afternoon, l'Occitane bath products.....all the stellar reviews are fully deserved!!! I hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our honeymoon! Very friendly, helpful and accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNella
Reviews.Content: Excellent, friendly, helpful service! Quiet and beautiful rooms. Gorgeous, yummy breakfast! Exactly as reviewed by other happy customers. Thanks to all the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nice, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ErezBenM0she
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter near Luxemburg Gardens. We stayed there for three nights. The staff is genuinely friendly and helped us with recommendations and reservations. The room was equipped with a safe and a refrigerator full of water bottles and soft drinks for free. We had a nice breakfast at the hotel although in Paris it is easy to find a nice boulangerie and have coffee and a good pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly same positive experience as other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: sandyinhgs
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, you expect that the hotel won't be exactly the same as what the other reviewers have written but in this case, our stay was pretty much the same as everyone else's. It's a lovely hotel, convinient and comfortable. Loved the breakfasts and at 12 euros thought it was very reasonable. Felt like you were staying at someon'es home - a lovely home with lovely bedrooms. My daughter especially loved the bathroom. Quite an ingenious way of using space! Staff were all very pleasant, friendly and very attractive as well!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a chic hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Katyorks
Reviews.Content: Rooms were beautifully designed and furnished, small touches like the complimentary coffee in the lounge made you feel like you were at home. The staff were great and extremely helpful with recommendations and bookings. Location great, few minutes walk from the great bars and restaurants of St Germain and Odeon, and close to the RER for Gare du Nord. Excellent, and good value for money as booked online direct with the hotel and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: carly1383
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We definitely were not disappointed! After a quick journey on RER B from Gare du Nord we arrived mid afternoon to a welcoming reception. The receptionist gave us a map of Paris and some useful bits of information and said if we had any specific questions to just ask at reception. We had planned our trip before arriving and so we didn't have too many questions but I heard them helping many other guests whilst we were there. We had booked the 3 nights for the price of 2 deal with breakfast included and we had been upgraded to a superior room. Our room was 70s themed and pink and white. Yes the room is small (but I think the clue is in the name of the hotel!) but everything is very well thought out and there is enough storage space if you are organised. The bathroom was amazing! The shower was huge and had 2 shower heads - 1 from the ceiling and 1 from a portable showerhead also. The twinkly lights in the grout of the tiles were beautiful. I see some people had mentioned the showers leaking - my o/h found the shower did leak a little but I didn't have that problem. Breakfast was downstairs in the "study" area and was a lovely continental breakfast with fruit, yoghurt, cereals, toast and pastries. We certainly had no complaints. The hotel is in a really good location, we found that we walked to most of the sights. The batobus stop is down beside Notredam which we took when we went to the Eiffel Tower. After a hard days sightseeing we enjoyed coming back to the hotel and sitting in the study area to enjoy the complimentary tea and coffee before heading out for dinner. We would thoroughly recommend le Petit Paris to anyone visiting Paris and had a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: dopetasticq
Reviews.Content: very helpful and informed staff. great location in the heart of Latin Quarter. We would return again for sure. The only complains, which are small, would be that the walls are rather thin so we could hear conversations in the next room, which was a distraction when some noisy neighbors checked in with a small child. And the wifi was a little unreliable at times. Not major deterrents for us!

Reviews.Title: “A 'Grande' Experience at Hotel Le Petit Paris”
Reviews.Author: JeanDublin
Reviews.Content: What a BRILLIANT EXPERIENCE this HOTELwas for us. We availed of their 3 for 2 night special in Superior Rooms - each room was individually decorated with beautiful furnishings, a huge bed and A THEME - ours was MEDIEVAL. From the moment we stepped into the hotel, which is only 3 minutes walk from RER B line straight from Charles de Gaulle Airport we knew we had chosen wisely. The STAFF were clearly interested in us and gave us lots of help during our stay, the room was cleaned daily, the towels were huge and fluffy and the toiletries in the Bathroom were first class. The Bathroom is something else with a Fantastic Shower with water coming from the ceiling - what luxury - easily the Best we have experienced in Paris ever. Location wise the hotel is on one of the oldest streets 'La Rue St Jacques' parallel with The Boulevard St Michel and the Luxembourg Gardens - its full of lovely restaurants, bars and patisserie shops - it takes 10 minutes to walk to Notre Dame Cathedral and 2 minutes to The Pantheon. IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR LUXURY AT REALLY GREAT PRICES FOR THE CITY OF LIGHT WE RECOMMEND THIS FANTASTIC HOTEL - IT HAS EVERYTHING YOU COULD WISH FOR, Remember that old saying that you only stay in the hotel at night - DON'T BELIEVE IT - everyone needs a lovely hotel to come back to after an exhausting day sightseeing in Paris and when we came back in the evenings we sat in our lovely breakfast area and had complementary Tea and Coffee and a great chat about what we did that day. OVERALL THIS HOTEL OFFERS EVERYTHING YOU COULD WISH FOR AND WE WILL RETURN ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: geologist427
Reviews.Content: First, let me start with the staff... Wonderful. Karim, Alexandria, and Litizia were fantastic. Whoever owns this gem, needs to give them a raise. Helpful, cordial, like we had our own private concierges. They arranged transporation, dinner reservations, recommendations. They were great. The wait staff were great as well. I ordered coffee every morning, and they were quick and always nice. Our room was meticulously cleaned every day. Location... I don't think I could have chosen a better location. We walked everywhere. One of the best restaurants is right around the corner, les Papilles. We only had breakfast there one day, otherwise we would walk out the front door, and turn right and walk to the fruit stand and get wonderful fruit in the morning and then head out for the pasteries! Very safe neighborhood as well. If it is your first time in Paris, you will love this location. Cleanliness... Very clean. Period. Beds/Linens... Wonderful. Crisp, clean and fresh. Price... A little high, but in the long run worth it. Noise... Our first night we were on the street in a large room (paid for a small one), and never heard the street. The next six nights we overlooked the little courtyard. Completely quiet. I don't know about the other reviews that complained of the noise. Overall... We were there in late September, and had a wonderful time. The room was a bit small, and the shower did leak a bit, but otherwise I can't say enough about this hotel. Free wi-fi as well! I would definitely go back to this hotel. I love Hotel le Petit Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in a Stylish Boutique Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMBTraveller
Reviews.Content: Le Petit Paris Hotel did not disappoint in anyway!!! From the warm welcome on our arrival to the courteous and helpful staff throughout our stay. Nice touches such as umbrellas provided when there was a hint of rain shower. Great Location to the RER B station Luxembourg which is only 5mins walk from Hotel and provides a great link to airport. Rooms are very stylish and the bed was memory foam so a great nights sleep! Free WIFI throughout the stay was a nice touch and the complementary tea and coffee throughout the day was also a great bonus. The 'Honesty' bar was also a great idea. The Hotel has is in a great location to explore with plenty of cafes and restaurants near by while St Michel and St Germain are a 10min walk while Notre Damn is about 15mins. Staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants etc. Would highly recommend the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Something different and absolutely awesome”
Reviews.Author: Tasia15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect example of what a boutique hotel should look/feel like. it was intimate with a friendly person to meet, assist and greet you. We stayed in a suite to help fit the 4 of us and the bathroom was gorgeous! (Travelling around Europe you get excited when you have a descent bathroom!). In the evening we turned off the air conditioning and left our beautiful french doors/windows open to let the fresh air in. As incredible as it is, it was actually quite peaceful cause the window faced the hotel's inner court yard. For those travelling with families or on a long trip, it's an absolute bonus having the laundrymat right next door. I used to go put my washing on, come back to the hotel or go down the road for a drink and then come back in time to collect my washing and take it straight to my room. The hotel is in a location that has some great restaurants around - including amazing delis and cheese shops and close enough to some of the tourist spots of St Germain. Loved it and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a Wonderful Chic Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: GaryandSally3934
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 glorious nights at this wonderful contemporary chic hotel. All of the staff we encountered were wonderful, very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is spotlessly clean. Our bedroom was 503 on the top floor and although not overly spacious it was extremely comfortable with an added bonus of a view to the Eiffel Tower's twinkling night lights which we could watch from our bed. The location is fantastic with great restaurants, great shopping, the Pantheon and the Luxembourg Gardens all within a easy 5-10 min walk and an enjoyable 30 min walk to virtually any of the major sites. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quirky but just right”
Reviews.Author: s2az
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights. The Hotel is a couple blocks from the Pantheon and the Sorbonne, and about a ten minute walk from Notre Dame. There are many places to eat within easy walking distance. (On recommendation of another guest, we tried the restaurant immediately across the street, Coup de Torchon, and had our best of many good dining experiences in Paris.) A nearby RER station and bus stop can get you places you don't want to walk. The Hotel is small, as were our rooms. We had to be moved from one room to another after our first night because of a booking mix-up (between one of the travel sites and the hotel), graciously and quickly fixed by the attentive, friendly staff. Our fifth floor room overlooked the street, had tiny balconies off the bath and bedroom, but as it was on a high floor, some architectural features made the room seem smaller. Our second floor room, where we spent most of the week, had about the same footprint, yet because of the layout seemed more spacious, though it faced a courtyard and had no balconies. The rooms were modern and kept spotlessly clean throughout. A small in-room fridge held complimentary water and juice, and the honor bar in the evenings off the modern lobby was a nice touch and a good way to get to know fellow guests and staff. All in all, a small, quiet haven from the bustle of Paris that we would recommend to anyone who does not require the more common comforts and size of a major chain.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous ... fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: ect-tj
Reviews.Content: We spent only night at le Petit Paris, but would have loved longer. The service was exceptional with the concierge going out of her way to accomodate our needs. Their restaurant recommendation was spot-on! - I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Trip31083
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 3 nights in October. The location was great - walking distance to restaurants and nightlife, as well as all the sites. The staff could not be more helpful and spoke very good English. The room was small, but we hear this is typical for Paris hotels - it was beautiful and clean and had everything we needed. Definitely will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing chic hotel but shocked by the small room”
Reviews.Author: J-Wo-2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Petit Paris having read the reviews on this site. We arrived early and our room wasn't quite ready so we left our bags with reception who were really helpful. The decor is quite incredible and very stylish. It felt very trendy. We loved the feel of the place and the shared areas. We were quite shocked that our room was quite so small - I guess that is Parisian hotel rooms! It is well located for picking up Velib bikes which we did for 2 days and loved. It is also a great location for some great cafes just down the hill. Overall we would recommend it although with exchange rates it was pricey. It is not a bad location for getting around but not at the heart of the big sights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautful, modern jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsquigley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! It has been recently renovated, by the looks of it. The room, while not huge, was most adequate in size. It was beautifully appointed and the bathroom was very luxurious, sleek and modern. There is a nice foyer and comfortable space for guests to relax and enjoy coffee and tea in the afternoons and a light bar in the evenings. The staff was extremely professional and helpful with dinner reservations and reserving taxis for us. We loved being in the Latin Quarter, very close to the Sorbonne. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is very charming, with restaurants, boulangeries, cafes. Close to transportation. Would definitely recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: LuvtheVineyard
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel le Petit Paris at 11a.m after an overnight flight from NYC. Laetitia from the front desk immediately tried to get us in our rooms. While we sat and waited for 20 minutes she brought us a bottle of Evian and offered us coffee. Just the beginning of a wonderful weekend of service. Our rooms were beautiful. One room on the first floor was decorated in beautiful shades of pinks. The other room on the 4th floor with a terrace was perfect in shades of green. The terrace was a small area with 2 chairs with many leafy plants. The view was up and down Rue Saint Jacques. What a great spot to drink our bottle of champagne sent from friends at home. The rooms weren't huge but we had plenty of space. Yes, the shower walls are not designed that well so you often times have mini floods on the bathroom floors but the showers were wonderful with excellent water pressure. The honor bar was a great idea. We used it almost every night before and after we went out to dinner. On our last night after returning from a late dinner, we sat in the lobby with other guests from Australia till 3:30 am. The gentleman at the front desk never acted like he was put out to be cleaning up our glasses at that hour. And the prices for drinks at the honor bar are beyond reasonable. Overall, I can not say enough about this wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Paris. You will not feel like tourists when you step out the front door. You will feel like this is your Paris neighborhood as you walk off to buy something at the boulangerie or patisserie a few doors down. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kads_sing
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Paris. The staff is very friendly, the rooms tastefully decorated and the location is excellent, especially if you're there with children (close to Luxembourg gradens). We booked another hotel and were horrified at the size of it, we were travelling with a 1 year old and absolutely needed a comfortable place with enough space. We called and booked a triple room at Le Petit, it was just perfect for us. it also had a little balcony where we could relax and have a meal or so after the bub slept. Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “You need to go and stay here”
Reviews.Author: Pieter333
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel and an excellent experience. If you are looking for comfort and style in a great location in Paris then book this hotel! The staff were fantastic and really helpful, we loved the 'honesty' bar. The decor was very unique and modern. I had the best shower I have ever had in my life. Rooms on the small side, but what you would expect for a hotel in central Paris called 'The little Paris Hotel'! Very clean, very good and very lovely. Will most certainly go and stay there again next time we go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Libl0u
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, yes, but well appointed. The shower was magnificent! Though over looking the street, our room was quiet. But best of all was the service. A very tiny, but extremely helpful staff who bent over backwards to be helpful. The hotel is very well located and close to our "kitchen away from home" - Les Papilles. I could not recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location for Paris sights”
Reviews.Author: plcape
Reviews.Content: Terrific location for being close to many of the sights of Paris .. Small hotel that was really well done, beautifully decorated. Staff was really friendly and helpful. Room was very small for us but well appointed.Should have reserved next room size. Overall this was a nice hotel in a terrific location

Reviews.Title: “94/100, Very Nice little Hotel well decorated, super comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Henson_8
Reviews.Content: Me & the wife just stayed for one night, could not rate Hotel service since we were in and out for 1 night, but one of the best rooms i have stayed in Paris shower and toilet is in separate room which we liked very much.. rooms are small but serves its purpose, Best Hotel breakfast Buffet style , Coffee was very good...I will come back to this Hotel because of the Bed..one of my best sleep nights during our 12 day travel... Location is 85/100 since its a walk to the Luxembourg station... will come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowie63
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed one night in this wonderful hotel. The staff is friendly, helpful & very informative. The rooms are not large but the space is very well utilized so that there is room for every thing. Really appreciated free WIFI in room. There are plenty of restaurants nearby & we enjoyed a delicious meal at Casa Valentino, just a couple of doors away. Breakfast was very good - attractively presented with plenty of choice The location is excellent, within walking distance of Notre Dam & other interesting attractions. If we visit Paris again we would definitely choose the le Petit Paris once again. Appreciated the free WIFI in our room

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located with Friendly, Profesional Staff”
Reviews.Author: diegocamille
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and would definitely consider coming back. The rooms are immaculate and nicely designed, with modern and contemporary finishes. The only downside is they are quite small, with the bathroom being especially tight - however, we imagine this is quite typical for Parisian hotels. The staff was knowledgeable, friendly and extremely accommodating. The location was very convenient, on the same RER line to the airport, a few blocks from the Pantheon and the heart of the Latin Quarter. Definitely a jewel!h

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the construction!”
Reviews.Author: mickyandlola
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights - 21st to 24th July. Had spoken to them over the phone and sent an e-mail that I needed a very quiet room (I had seen a review by customers who had had a problem with construction noise) - I was assured that would not be a problem! At 7.00 a.m. the next morning I knew it was going to be a problem. When I complained I was told there were no other rooms available - they offered me a free breakfast. My option was to find another hotel, but we were there for such a short time, I didn't want to spend it trying to find somewhere else to stay. Very unsatisfactory. Also our room was classified "Courtyard" - if you leant out the window and looked down you could see the courtyard, way below - the room should have been classified "rooftop". Despite the above - the rooms were extremely clean and bright and comfortable, albeit a little small. The bathroom was very pretty, but the shower did leak all over the floor. I might return to this hotel - good location - but I would need a written confirmation that their would be no construction close by.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel, small and friendly, well located”
Reviews.Author: pjg3
Reviews.Content: We (married couple and teenage daughter) found Le Petit Paris absolutely to our taste. It is a small, friendly, well located hotel. The rooms were confortable and stylish. My daughter was delighted with her seventies themed room and we were happy with our medieval style room. The staff well all very helpful and friendly and all had good English. The buffet breakfast was good and we particularly appreciated the availablity of tea or coffee through the afternoon and evening in the downstairs lounge area -- my daughter loved the hanging spherical chair. This was a very pleasant place to relax after a day walking around Paris or in the later evening after dinner. Location on the Rue St Jaques near the Pantheon is good. The RER is conveniently near for longer distances, but the Ile de Cite is just ten minutes walk away, good restaurants near at hand -- we eat a couple of times at a very pleasant Italian restaurant just two doors down and another twice at a good French restaurant only about four minutes away. An excellent little hotel. (I add in parenthesis that our initial booking did not work and the hotel were generous in the way they dealt with the problem and compensated us for our inconvenience.)

Reviews.Title: “A little lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jeeter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Petit Paris for 5 nights during our recent trip to Paris. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and the staff were very helpful at providing suggestions for authentic dinner spots and shows. Our room was very well appointed and luxurious, albeit teeny-tiny (not entirely unexpected for Europe). The location was good, on the edge of the Latin Quarter, although the walk to many of the tourist attractions (i.e. Eiffel Tower & Champs) sometimes was about an hour. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyGiselle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Only three stops on the RER B from where the EuroStar drops you off. The rooms are small BUT did not feel cramped at all. They are as beautiful as the pictures show. The receptionists really helped us with our very basic french and helped us with where we wanted to go and how we would ask for certain things The shower is the best I've ever had and we are going to try and copy the layout!! All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Friendly, Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: RedSonya
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Le Petit Paris for 4 days, 5 nights in July, 2010. We got the 3 for 2 nightly special, and it ended up being a pretty good deal for July in Paris. The hotel is located on a really cute street in the Latin Quarter. There are stores and restaurants nearby, and it is right next to the Luxembourg gardens. We walked everywhere in central Paris from the hotel (never taking public transport...Montmarte, Notre Dame, Marais, Arc De Triomphe, Louvre, St. Germain, etc). The hotel is spectacularly decorated and the rooms were comfy. The nice-touches: great decor, comfy rooms, nice bathroom, complimentary coffee, tea, water and biscuits, great wifi that worked consistently, a public computer from which guests can print e-tickets, and a full spread of alcoholic beverages available at night under the honor system. Also, we made last minute plans to vacate our reservation early in order to detour to Monaco, and the hotel accommodated our change and gave us the 3 for 2 special even though our early departure cut off our 6th and free night. The drawbacks: The front desk staff was very helpful, but not overly friendly (with the exception of Abdul who was awesome!). The rooms are really small (but I assume this is typical Parisian style). They did not have any guidebooks or tourist tools of any sort. This, combined with the fact that those at the front desk often said they didn't know where certain things were, was somewhat frustrating. The shower in our room leaked significantly and this caused the bathroom floor to be constantly wet. Overall, this hotel was really good. With a few tweaks, it could be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Paris71
Reviews.Content: Being non french speaking Australians we encountered, from our early morning arrival to the end of our 4 day stay, friendly, helpful staff. The language barrier was not a problem, all had a good understanding of English. Our first discovery; their exceptional coffee maker followed by delicious breakfasts. The availability of all day tea or coffee making facilities in the Breakfast area and the honor bar at night made our stay pleasurable. We enjoyed our themed pink '60's room, very fitting for our 40th wedding anniversary celebrations. A little small, but it is Paris. It is situated in a good location easy walking to the metro, great shops, museums, gardens and cafes. We felt safe walking at night. The front desk kindly arranged our bus tour to Normandy, printed out a Google map for our walking adventure to Sacre Coeur, and it was never a trouble for then to call us a cab when needed. Best liked the decor and color scheme of reception and the idea of themed rooms. Least liked the lack of storage space in the bathroom. Will definitely recommend to family and friends and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Would Recommend to All!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_2010Paris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I actually discovered this hotel through Trip Advisor. After reading all of the reviews, we were very excited about staying at this hotel. We felt that we discovered a gem, and we were not disappointed once we got there! We stayed at le Petit for 8 nights and were thoroughly impressed with the hotel and the staff. We stayed in a triple deluxe room, and we had plenty of room for our 3 large suitcases (and the souvenirs as they added up)!
