We took advantage of the Honor Bar the Hotel offers and enjoyed drinks in the little courtyard. After many long days of walking the city, coming back to the Hotel felt like coming home. The Hotel has such a cozy and inviting atmosphere! We owe so many thanks to the hotel staff - they were wonderful! On our first night there, we discovered that our room did not have a safe installed yet. The next day we had one! We consulted with the ladies at the front to get their advice on places to go, suggestions for the best way to get to certain places, etc. While I am sure they are often bombarded with these types of questions all day, they never showed any sign of irritation. Each person we dealt with seemed more than happy to help us. That is a very reassuring feeling being a foreigner in another country. As far as location goes, we felt this hotel was in a great spot. We were close to a metro station, and were close enough for pleasant walks to Notre Dame, the Louvre, and the lively streets within the Latin Quarter. I could definitely go on and on about this Hotel. Bottom line....my wife and I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. We were in Paris celebrating our anniversary, and this Hotel will be a part of our Paris memory forever. When we go back to Paris, we will definitely stay at le Petit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and ideally located!”
Reviews.Author: Newhart
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay in Paris, close to the Marais and Ile de la Cite! This hotel maximizes its limited space with very a very mod lobby and the staff is charming and extremely helpful. Every morning woke up and walked to Jardin du Luxembourg for a coffee and croissant! Great restaurant recommendations from the staff as well...

Reviews.Title: “good adress in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuccaM12
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in le petit Hotel with my Family from July 25th. Location is great, Staff really attentive to every needs. Rooms and Lobby are designed and relaxing will be back next time in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: inthelooper
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms were gorgeously appointed. At night they would put out an Honor bar and you could pour your glass of wine and just write down your room number and they charge u at check out. Location wise, it is right off the metro line and extremely close to Jardin du Luxembourg. You can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located & good value!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAhmat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Le Petit Paris for 6 nights for our honeymoon. We found the hotel very conveniently located. It's right in the heart of the Latin Quartier (5th arrondissement) and we were within walking distance to the Panthéon, Jardin du Luxembourg, Église St-Sulpice, Notre Dame... 15 minutes walk from the hotel brought us to St-Germain, where we found plenty of good restaurants and cafés. The closest subway station to the hotel is the RER line, Luxembourg. Despite the frequent delays, it was the most efficient way to get around the city. Service was impeccable. The staff are friendly and very helpful. They were always happy to recommend places to eat and they certainly recommended well! MUST TRY: Le Comptoir du Panthéon! Clean cosy room with modern deco and a really really comfortable bed. The free self-service afternoon tea at the hotel lobby was a good idea. Every day we would stop for a little refreshment while planning for the rest of the evening itinerary. The only downside is the room was quite small and the bathroom floor gets flooded after each shower. Will I recommend this hotel? Yes, it's a good value if you wish to be centrally located in a small boutique hotel. Will I come back? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION!!!”
Reviews.Author: KHL1616
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I will always stay at “Petit”. The owner Fred and his wife are amazing and so is their staff, I can’t imagine how anyone could write a negative review. The rooms are spotless and adorable. The shower is one of the best I have ever used and the “honor” bar was a delight. You will feel at home in this little gem in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Vive le petit !”
Reviews.Author: wolfiriegler
Reviews.Content: There are so many things I could say about this hotel. All of them are positive. The staff was gracious and responsive to any request. The room was brand new and lovely. We were traveling with our six year old and the hotel welcomed him warmly. It was quiet. In a good way. The hotel is seemingly off the beaten track, but around the corner from various amenities including a _great_ wine bar. (which the hotel recommended) We liked the vibe of the neighborhood and felt quite comfortable there whether we were "whooping" it up or "vegging" out. It was also an amazing place to come back to after spending breathtaking days and nights out and about. The hotel isn't a scene, but a sophisticated take on being laid back and off beat. It is a hotel to be discovered...go and enjoy. Now...while you can.

Reviews.Title: “All perfect”
Reviews.Author: Eva14lia
Reviews.Content: The size is just in the name! It is petit in size but that said all the rest was amazing. We planned our vacations in Paris a while ago and booked this hotel because of its great reviews. We wanted to something romantic with leisure because this was our first time in Paris and we did not want to be disappointed and thank God we were not. The hotel even exceeded our expectations, great design, familiar colours, great location, helpful staff, my special thanks to Leticia by the way who was excellent! We had breakfast twice at the hotel and it was ok. The compliment coffee was the greatest way to relax in the rainy afternoon. RER was close to us but we mostly used the bus since it was much closer to the hotel - Lines 21 and 27 were a good correspondence to all Paris. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a couple, especially to newly weds!!!!! Thank you Petit Paris for everything we will definitely come back in Paris thanks to you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel near the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: Vivaldis
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel Le Petit Paris as a good location for our stop-over before flying back home from Charles de Gaulle. We flew into Paris via Orly, so this was one of the more readily accessible locations to both airports via public transit. We always look for good value "boutique" hotels when we travel, realizing we are going to spend little time in the room, but still not wanting the chain hotel feel. Le Petit Paris fit the bill perfectly, combining period and modern furnishings, all with a very new feel. Our room was plush, with all the amenities, complemented by a very modern (split) bathroom (see photos). The truly king size bed does cramp the room, but was much appreciated. A small balcony, with seating, allowed us to enjoy Paris the last night of our 3-week trip. Continental breakfast is not included as part of the price, but we took advantage of it anyway. It was adequate, with good quality ingredients, but not very lavish. The staff was very helpful, giving us a great tip on local dining, and otherwise tending to our requests. For expensive Paris, we felt the Hotel Le Petit Paris was a very reasonable value. It met every expectation and gave us a few surprising extras.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent a week at Le Petit and absolutely loved it. Alexandra and Laetitia were extremely helpful with any detail. We personally loved the breakfast each morning, and after buying coffee and pastries on the street one day, concluded that the offerings at Le Petit were reasonable and super convenient. We loved our rooms and found them to be quite adequate in size. The beds were heavenly after our very long days of sightseeing, and the rooms were very quiet from the street traffic. We jogged in Luxembourg Gardens and enjoyed several restaurants in the immediate area. You MUST go to Les Papilles. The food was divine, wine selection superb, and atmosphere casual and energetic. We would most definitely stay at Le Petit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a bit clinical”
Reviews.Author: ukgirl1980
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to sights but away from crowds. However, the hotel was a bit disappointing. Yes, the decor is fabulous if you like modern interior design, and the shower is great, but we felt it was a little 'clinical' and sacrificed comfort at the sake of style . We weren't keen on our pink room, and although it was a superior it was tiny even compared to other boutique hotels we've stayed in in Europe. The staff were polite but not very knowledgeable - they told us the wrong place to get the tour bus so we walked for miles in the rain to find the right stop, we would expect them to know these things and have leaflets about them. On Saturday morning (busiest day) the breakfast waitress could speak no English, and although we are French speakers many of the other guests were not so this caused problems. Also, on the final night the electricity went off at midnight and didn't come back on until 7am. It was 28 degrees outside and without air conditioning we had to open the windows onto the very noisy street below (it doesn't look that noisy, but with wagons and scooters going up and down at 4am it was hard to sleep). There was no apology the next morning and no attempt to compensate for the lack of sleep! There are also no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, and we were quite surprised on departure to discover we had been charged 12 Euros for the 'complimentary' bottles of water we drank which were in the room. There was no sign indicating a price attached to these drinks, and we felt this was a little over the top! To conclude, I probably WOULD recommend this hotel to someone looking for a clean, stylish hotel in a good location at good price. But I think next time we would choose somewhere a bit more cosy and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mondave
Reviews.Content: Groovy rooms with trendy decor and very clean with everything working. Close to central Paris and train (RER). Surrounded by good food joints. Common area with free coffee after midday and a bar with a good wine selection and nice outdoor area to relax. Staff friendly and helfpful.

Reviews.Title: “Petit but fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SusyLincoln
Reviews.Content: Surpise weekend arranged by the husbland in Paris! Used Tripadvisor to find a hotel and he found Hotel le Petit Paris. As everyone has said before, fantastic location, beautiful appointed hotel, small but perfect. The public areas were ultra clean and the staff were so polite and courteous, couldn't do enough for you. Honesty bar was so good with a lovely selection of drinks. Breakfast selection wasn't the biggest but it didn't disappoint. To conclude everything about le Petit Paris is small but perfect. I intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location-great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigibutch
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is great--right around the corner from the Pantheon and near the Latin Quarter. The room was small but beautifully decorated. Everything first class. The bed was really comfortable and the shower was groovy!!! You'll have fun if u stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, lovely hotel with the best beds and linen in town”
Reviews.Author: JeanneL1234
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 day holiday in Paris recently, and stayed at le Petit for 2 nights and the rest of the time at the Odeon in St Germain. (le Petit was fully booked for the other nights) We found le Petit lovely. Excellent value for money. The location was good, although we prefered the St Germain area. le Petit is about a 10 minute walk to the restaurants and bistros of the area. its in a quiet part of the latin quarter. the decor is trendy and stylish (maybe a bit on the clinical side) (once again we found the Odeon's rooms more romantic) le petit has the best beds with the puffiest duvets and pillows ever. We had very good sleep. The bathrooms are petit, but ours had a very nice shower complete with sparkly lights. No place to put any toiletries in bathroom, and no full length mirror. Staff were friendly, but we did not find the lobby a place to linger.

Reviews.Title: “Tout c'est bon!”
Reviews.Author: mliu
Reviews.Content: Everything is brand new and clean. Love the rain shower. It is a really cool boutique hotel where you feel part of Paris instead of a guest in a American mega-chain. Staff is really friendly and helpful. They were able to find us a tailor and describe how to get there very clearly. One downside to the location is that everything nearby closes around 10pm. An upside to this is that everything is more authentic, less crowded and quiet. However, if you are like us, and didn't appropriately adjust to the time difference, asking to leave the hotel at 2am (which is only 8pm EST), you discover that much is closed. There is a lively area (read: clubs) down by Notre Dame, St Michel area but it is very touristy. All in all---LOVED it. Would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: thesuperfoodchef
Reviews.Content: Spotless. Charming. Brand New. Beautiful Decor. Perfectly Appointed. Best Location. Impeccable and Helpful Service from the Devoted Staff. It is a boutique hotel so the rooms are not large (for those who are not used to the room dimensions in Europe....like North Americans with large suitcases). Personally, I can not fault this place and I will book it again when I return next month! Glad I found you, Hotel Le Petit Paris !! See you soon!! Chef Michelle

Reviews.Title: “This Place is AWESOME...Just Stay There!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal80
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing and wonderful boutique hotel. It is within walking distance of the Pantheon and other great sites in Paris, lots of restaurants and cafes nearby...the staff is amazing, the room, new, wonderful, charmingly decorated, the bathroom was AWESOME!!! I loved this hotel...nice boutique in Paris...it feels 5 star!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, nicely appointed, modernized hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Le Petit Paris. Old building but totally modernized and "ultra hip" inside. Very jazzy. Staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. Location is good...just a few minutes away from the Metro, la Sorbonne, the Pantheon and les jardins de Luxembourg. Lots of restos and boulangeries around. Some street noise, mostly from trucks off rue St. Jacques. We paid extra for a larger than standard room which was lovely, but small by North American standards. Hard to find places to put one's "stuff". For example, no shelving or indents in the shower stall, so one had to leave shampoo, etc. on the floor. Some very innovative and cute uses of light. Great TV and bed. In any event, a VERY nice establishment which I would not hesitate to recommend. Having said this, it was not inexpensive. Free high-speed internet in the rooms (wireless) which was great.

Reviews.Title: “All that is said in other reviews with one warning.”
Reviews.Author: fishpicturesbybob
Reviews.Content: We got to Le Petit after 3 weeks traveling from Amsterdam, through Germany and a week in Avignon. Our stay in Le Petit was for 6 nights and we each had a suitcase and a smaller roller bag. My caution is that the rooms are small. We had the deluxe double room and the room was very nice with a comfortable bed and bathroom but virtually no closet or storage available. We stacked the suitcases in one corner and took out what we thought we would need for the week in Paris but of course it was a daily ritual digging the suitcases out and finding things we needed. The suitcases and roller bags made getting around the small room even more difficult. The hotel was finished within the last year in an older building but the interior and all of the furnishings are brand new and comfortable. The staff was excellent and spoke English. They were very knowledgeable and their directions were right on. The wireless internet service in the room was excellent and they had a laptop in the lobby for those that do not want to carry one. There was a small Italian restaurant 3 doors from the hotel going towards Notre Dame that we found to be excellent. There are small grocery stores, wine stores, bakeries, cheese and other such stores all within 2 blocks. You are within 1 block of the bus service and 3 blocks to the subway. We walked to Notre Dame and several other close locations and used the bus and subway for the other Paris attractions. Cab service to and from the hotel to the train stations were made without problems. Please do not strike this hotel due to the size of the rooms. It is everything that all of the reviews cover but you should expect the room to be a lot smaller than you are used to in other world locations. If we return to Paris for a short trip with much less luggage this will be my choice for a hotel. My last comment is that when we left Paris we took the Train to London. This is a two hour trip and you are only under the channel for 20 minutes. We both agree that travel through Europe by Train is the only way to go and from now on we will home base out of London or Rome and use the Train for all of our Europe travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved le Petit”
Reviews.Author: vetin02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel le Petit Paris in May for 8 nights in one of their standard rooms. The vacation was wonderful and we really enjoyed staying at the hotel. We arrived in the morning so were unable to check in right away but stashed our bags at the hotel and did a little exploring in the meantime. The hotel is very near the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter of Paris. We felt the location ended up being a good place for us to stay - there is a park, the Luxembourg Gardens, a couple blocks from the hotel that is a favorite of Parisians to go and sit, relax, picnic, etc. The metro stop is pretty convenient and other than hoofing it, was the sole mode of transportation that we used. Bike rentals are throughout the city and the bus system is also supposedly very good (you can use metro tickets for the buses too), but we didn't end up using either. The hotel is one metro stop and easily within walking distance to Notre Dame. The hotel itself was very clean with excellent staff. The room we had was small with a WC on one side of the room and the shower/sink near the entrance to the room. Our room faced in toward the central courtyard (a small area with a couple of outdoor tables) and was next to the elevator on the 1st floor (one up from the lobby). I've noticed people posted regarding noise issues and we did not experience that problem. If anything, we had to be careful not to oversleep as we did one Sunday morning until 10:30am. I do tend to bring earplugs whenever I travel, but my wife does not and is a light sleeper and had no issues whatsoever with noise. And this was supposedly one of the busiest times as all hotels in Paris were booked and we had many people tell us that it is the most people they've ever seen in Paris - so the lack of noise was not due to a lack of people. The shower did leak onto the bathroom floor along the sides, but didn't affect our trip at all. Just be careful not to leave clothes on the floor when showering or they might get wet. Other than that, I cannot think of anything negative. They have an espresso machine downstairs that we would use free in the evenings. They also put out an honor bar (liquor and wine) at night - we didn't use it but it looked like they had a number of selections. We also didn't eat breakfast there although it appeared as if a number of people did. There are a few restaurants that serve breakfast in the morning by the Pantheon and numerous bakeries to grab a pastry on the way to wherever you are headed. The staff was very nice - we mostly dealt with two nice young women at the front desk who offered good restaurant recommendations and directions. The room itself was maintained very well by the cleaning staff. The bottom line is that we enjoyed the hotel, would return, felt we paid less than comparable hotels, and would recommend this hotel to friend or family. We booked directly on the hotel's website and I would recommend that as they had better deals on their website itself than the travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: burk13
Reviews.Content: boutique hotel with great and helpful staff and modern/cool vibe. Although small, it was one of our favorites in our 2 week europe trip. Coffee maker downstairs is great touch and free wifi worked well in the rooms if you have laptop or itouch. There is a gyro place across the street that was packed at all times and looked great but we did not get a chance to eat there. Didn't have breakfast there as there are tons of bakeries and shops around. Shower can leak as stated but an easy remedy was to open the swinging door inward and viola, no issue. Had a room facing the street with a balcony and no noise issues during the week. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, sleep quality so so coz of thin walls”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel to sleep for a few hours in between a flight from HK into Paris and the next flight from Paris to Morocco. So basically arrived at the hotel around 8 am and left at 11 am. liked the location (a few blocks walk from notre dame), beautifully designed space ( cool living room, breakfast area ) nicely designed bathrooom and bedroom as well. Check in and out was quick efficient and the staff helpful and friendly. Only downer was that I could hear my neighbors (once they woke up) and also what seemed like endless noise coming from the cleaner vacuuming the surrounding areas. This place gets a 5 for the design, a 4 for the location, but a 3 for the thin walls

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its high rating on tripadvisor, the fact it was (shockingly) the ONLY hotel from Paris included in the "Most Romantic European hotels" list, and because of its location. We were not disappointed. We booked the green room that is pictured on the site and in some of the pictures in tripadvisor, which is one of the few with a private balcony, and we loved it. The decor was as we expected, bright, modern and charming, and everything was spotlessly clean. We didn't end up using the balcony much at all, but enjoyed having it there to check the weather conditions, and for peering out at Paris once in a while. The bed was very comfortable, and the shower was amazing, with a large rainshower overhead as well as a handheld nozzle. Roomwise, we had a couple of minor quibbles. The toilet was in a separate little closet that is in the entry hall, not in the bathroom, which proved to be a bit inconvenient having to walk across the bedroom to wash your hands, but not a big deal, and there were obviously advantages to having the toilet separate. The only other issue was that the room was quite small, which we expect in Paris, so there was not a lot of room to lay-out and open the suitcases. However, the charm of the room made it feel very homey and comfortable. The staff was amazing. Everyone was friendly, helpful, smiling and charming. They helped us get tickets to see Moulin Rouge after we had called the theatre ourselves already and been told it was sold out...and we were seated right next to the stage, which we couldn't tell was because of the hotel or not, but it was unexpected and nice. We were on our honeymoon and our friends had arranged for surprise gift baskets, flowers and bottles of champagne to be sent to our room twice over the course of our stay, and I was told that the hotel staff had been very helpful in making these arrangements, and the gifts were very well arranged in the room when we arrived. The common areas to the hotel are also very beautifully decorated in a very colorful, crisp and modern way. Its the only lobby area that we have ever spent time in. We actually hired a Parisian photographer for a Paris photoshoot, and when we showed her pics of our hotel she was so taken with the decor she insisted on doing part of our shoot in the hotel. There was a breakfast eating area which was also very inviting as well as a private outdoor courtyard. Breakfast was for a fee, and we paid for it once and it was a simple and fine. There was an honesty bar that had tea and coffee in the afternoon and I believe booze in the evening but we were always out. The location was also good as its right in the latin quarter, and not a long walk at all to the St Germain des Pres area. It was also reasonably close to the subway. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, elegant, comfortable... helpful front desk...just ask!”
Reviews.Author: WalkingOnADream
Reviews.Content: I will try and not go over the same ground as the other reviewers, but we had 3 nights in mid April and it was blissful... we had a superior room on the 3rd floor. What you should know... When you arrive, you will be greeted by wonderful and helpful staff - don't hesitate to ask for advice on things to see and do and restaurants. They make you feel really welcome and are quick in checking you in. Oh, and ask for the free wifi in the rooms, it's excellent and reliable. As the hotel suggests, it's petit... the lift is tiny, you step out and you're virtually on top of the room door. But once you open the door, the rooms are bright (they /are/ compact) but are decorated so beautifully - the bathrooms are a treat... that sort of rainwater style shower, deep bath. We had a problem with water leaking on to the floor from while we showered, which was a minor renovating glitch. At the time we stayed there, they didn't have a safe, and they apologised and said they are getting them soon. But they were happy to put our things in their own safe at the front desk. They have a decent hairdryer, but I think you may have to ask for an iron/ironing board. The L'Occitane products in the bathroom are a nice touch. Housekeeping is great too. The capsule coffee in the downstairs is on from 12pm and it's great after a long walk to just come knock one back in the teeny courtyard and relax for a moment. The location is great too... I recommend Cafe Soufflot on Rue de Soufflot for a beer/wine after a long day's walk, sitting outside... the sunshine beaming down.. fabulous.... The local train compay office is nearby if you need to organise train tickets to somewhere else (I recommend Avignon for a mind blowing experience in Provence). Overall, if you're looking for something that feels modern, chic... where the staff make you feel wanted, welcomed... they are eager to help... (it was super easy to print out tickets we required using their communal laptop)... this hotel will make you walk away feeling "wow, this was a lovely special experience, what a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Petite and Pretty - but not Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Keeley_Mansfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel le Petit Paris for three nights at the end of April. We booked the double deluxe room. It was initially quite expensive, but we got one night free as part of a Spring deal, which made it more manageable. The hotel is well-located for sights, attractions and also for eateries, so the price isn't really surprising. The room and en-suite bathroom were very stylish, and I really liked the lime and purple decor (though I appreciate it may not be to everyone's taste). The room was very small, but we didn't need to spend much time in there so it didn't bother us. The bed was of normal size, but I found being boxed in by the wardrobes either side a little claustrophobic. The bathroom was nice, though short on storage space. The little lights set into the grouting in the bathroom were very pretty, and I loved the L'Occitane toiletries. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The lounge/lobby area was quite comfortable, and the complimentary tea and coffee were a nice touch (especially the Nespresso machine). One note about the honesty bar - I'm not sure how "honest" the pricing is, at €10 for a whiskey!! We didn't stay for breakfast so I can't comment, though I did see it laid out - it looked tasty, though was very expensive - my advice would be to pick up something nice at a boulangerie and save yourself some money. A couple of issues: we were woken every morning by noisy construction work going on in what I assume was the building next door. I appreciate that the hotel itself may well have no control over this, but it would have been professional to forewarn us of the noise when we arrived (we couldn't be bothered requesting to move rooms once we'd settled in). Also, the shower leaked badly. There was water absolutely everywhere within moments of the shower being on. I heard another customer mention this at the desk one morning, and I mentioned it in passing upon checking out - the lady at the desk admitted that all shower doors needed to be resealed. For such a new hotel, this seems surprising. All in all, a nice little hotel, and generally I'd recommend it to people who wanted to stay in the area, but personally I'll be looking elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, excellent location, fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Grassshopper2010
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and helpful right from when you walk in the door. We stayed at Le Petit Paris for the first three days of April, the start of Easter, as part of an around the world trip. The staff couldn't be more helpful, from ushering us to our pre-booked room, to suggestions of fantastic nearby (everything is nearby!) restaurants. Breakfast is very ample and self serve, with the option of ordering a cooked meal (We had the omelette and it was very good). We had a fifth floor room, with an exceptionally comfortable bed; the room was compact while functional with a modern bathroom featuring LED lighting that resembled tiny stars twinkling at night. Everything we expected, and more, of a boutique hotel in the Latin quarter in Paris. A great place to stay! Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, friendly, clean with excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan1961
Reviews.Content: Great rooms which are stylish and with beautiful detail (atmospheric lighting in the bathroom grout!) excellent location and delicious food but the thing that made the Hotel so good is the quality of the staff. Very good English spoken and a desire to help you with any query. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a boutique hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: cprnempg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 12 nights during a recent visit to Paris. The trip was originally to be 7 nights, but we were detained in Paris due to airport closings from the Icelandic volcanic ash cloud. The owner extended our stay, and everyone was gracious, accommodating and helpful. The location is terrific - Latin Quarter, near Luxembourg Gardens and Pantheon, a very short walk to the Metro. (! 45' train ride from Charles DeGaulle Airport). Near many ethnic food places too. The hotel is immaculate, modernly furnished and upscale, with state-of-the art bathrooms, TV's, and furnishings. Bed was comfortable as ours at home and we are very particular! Hotel staff knowledgeable about local attractions and restaurants, and always available to help. English is spoken, if necessary. It was a pleasure to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in good area.”
Reviews.Author: richard_cambridge
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a long weekend to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary, and selected le Petit Paris on the basis of tripadvisor reviews. We were very satisfied, even though it's probably the most I've ever paid per square foot! The location is great, just a couple minutes walk from Luxembourg RER, thus very convenient to CDG airport, and of course in the Latin Quarter, and very convenient to everywhere in Paris. We stayed in a "standard room", which was quite small, and facing the rear courtyard, but very nicely appointed. As others have commented, the sparkly lighting in the bathroom is a lot of fun. It may well be worth spending a bit more for one of the somewhat larger rooms. I really loved the map-of-Paris carpeting in the halls and stairwell! Service was really excellent, competent and friendly. Anything we wanted, we got: advice on the neighborhood and restaurants, and even use of the office computer to copy some memory cards for my camera. Breakfast was very nice, and at 10 Euros, a better deal than many hotels of this class. Another nice and un-advertised touch: a self-service "honesty bar" serving glasses of wine, etc., in the evening. I highly recommend small boutique hotels like this, when they're this good.

Reviews.Title: “A little haven...”
Reviews.Author: George6101
Reviews.Content: What a find.. a true boutique hotel Fab rooms, designer decorated, spotlessly clean, great service and short walk from Notre Dame. Every thing you want from a boutique hotel, small personal, trendy and classy.

Reviews.Title: “A Petit honeymoon in this Petit hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SINGSTHESONGS
Reviews.Content: we had a belated honeymoon, being we married in December and we decided to goto Paris, Cologne Germany and Amsterdam... we JUST got back. trip was from march29-april 6... we were on somewhat of a budget being we are traveling to so many cities yet we wanted quality! this hotel was PERFECT for that! Great Price, Location and Room for a Petit Price... well, compared to some of the other hotels! we had a garden room (which was quiet but not really a garden but cute none the less) the hotel is situated right down the street from the Pantheon and a block or 2 from the Metro Luxemborg that gets you to and from anywhere (with connections). We walked to some of the major sites, Luxemborg Gardens, Nortre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, Le Conciergerie, and the Louvre. you don't HAVE to walk it all but it's possible. . . the one not so great thing about this hotel (and it really has NOTHING to do with the hotel) is that they suggested a restaurant that was SIMPLY AWFUL and me and my family are cooks and some chefs... maybe my standards are higher but Le Christine's located on Rue Christine was awful awful awful!!! first of all, my red wine.... freezing cold! NOTHING IS SERVED COLD IN EUROPE, AND RED WINE SHOULD BE THE LAST THING SERVED COLD! second, while sending back my chilled red wine, i noticed that everyone in the quaint restaurant spoke english... doesn't say much for their local clientele... lastly, pan seared scallops should be pan seared and not mushy and with no caramelization at all on them .. . my husband ordered the duck...which was basically boiled and with no flavor. so... don't go there and don't take that recommendation. they did recommend another place that we ended up not going too but looked AMAZING... Les Papelles. you NEED reservations!!! next trip. *oh and if you like indian, the place across the street from the hotel had great food and we ordered it to go and ate it in our room after a day of all our sightseeing and walking... over all, this hotel was great... staff was EXTREMELY HELPFUL and kind. . . and rooms were clean, cute and beds...VERY COMFY! A+ RATING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: This is one of those gems you find very rarely. It is a small boutique hotel situated in Saint Germain so convenient for the Left Bank. The hotel itself has just gone through a total renovation and has the clean freshly decorated smell. Colours are bold yet beautiful, everything you see on the hotel site and from the pictures on this site are accurate. You get a warm welcome on arrival, the staff speak English and are more than capable of giving you some excellent recommendations for using your time in Paris. We took a room at the front of the hotel due to some little work that was being conducted by the neighbouring property, as I understand the work will be completed in the next couple of weeks. I had a great nights sleep here, the beds were so comfortable! The bathroom was immaculate. Fellow travellers stay here! How often in your travelling experiences do you stay in places whose rooms are so new that you are one of the first guests? Coffee is left out the whole day, it is the capsule variety you can slip into the machine so you can choose the strength. I am not a fan of the strong Parisian coffee you buy in restaurants! Breakfast costs 10 euro per person and is worth it, there is not a massive spread but it is sufficent and will be far cheaper than going out to eat. There are many Americans in the hotel thanks to the favourable tripadvisor ratings and I heard many say how much they will miss this hotel. There is a complimentary computer terminal in the lounge area and I believe free wifi, I love it when hotels provide these things free. This is truly the kind of place you will recommend to your friends when they visit Paris, you can dress up or dress down here. It does not have any fancy restaurants in the hotel, but who needs them when there are so many just down the road! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gareth36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited Paris approximately 15 times in the last 2-3 years. We tend to stay in different hotels each time we visit and most recently we stayed for 3 nights at Hotel le Petit Paris. For the price that we paid this is the best hotel in Paris that we have stayed in. The reception staff are friendly and welcoming, the hotel is chic and modern with refined décor throughout. Our room was small which is typical of Parisian hotel rooms but it was also contemporary in design, elegant, extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean. The breakfast is very good and reasonably priced and the hotel is perfectly located, a short walk from the Latin Quarter. I can’t recommend this hotel enough to couples wanting to spend a romantic weekend in the world’s most beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris near the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: MarcMich
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris on a clothes shopping citytrip and also wanted to visit Versailles. The "Le Petit Paris" was chosen based on Tripadvisor rating, and frankly fulfilled all our wishes: it's a new hotel in a few old houses, looks very trendy, a lot of thought has been put in several small decoration details (the LED lighting in the bathrooms has already been mentioned), beds are very good. From your arrival, the impression you get is very good, with perfect reception service as well at night (we arrived around 23h) as during daytime. We had room 103, and like all rooms on that floor rooms are small, yet all you need is there. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, just a breakfast area, yet just accross the street you have several good choice restaurants. And the location is great to do many things in Paris: we walked from the hotel towards the Pantheon, then by the university to the Notre Dame, to end up in the shopping area at rue de Rennes. All of that by foot, no need for taxi. So we consider this hotel as a little gem, hidden in Paris. Not cheap, yet delivering perfect value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: LoriS31
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris to visit my daughter who is studying there. She joined me in the hotel so we got a room with twin beds. We stayed there two nights before we left for Normandy, but loved it so much that we made a reservation to return on Monday night. Yes, the rooms are small by American standards, but they were so well decorated and the space thought out very well. We especially loved the rain forest shower with the sparkle lights. The staff were very accommodating and very polite about speaking English for me. My daughter has already said that if she ever returns to Paris (and not on a student budget), she will stay at this hotel. It was very close to many things and if not, it is close to the Metro. I loved this hotel and found it to be a wonderful home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “le perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaRobbo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights early march and absolutely loved every minute of our stay. From the beautiful rooms to the great service from the very helpful reception and a great location we couldn't recommend a nicer hotel to stay at when visiting paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wacky decor, friendly & helpful staff, great shower.”
Reviews.Author: HowShouldIKnow
Reviews.Content: The Petit Paris is in a fabulous location in the Latin Quarter, close to the RER. The room was very clean with a fabulously comfortable bed. Despite being on the street it was very quiet. The evening concierge was very helpful and more than happy to allow me to practice my very bad French on him despite his English being fluent! There is no restaurant at the Hotel but this is no problem as the staff will recommend local eateries and book tables if you want.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find - we loved the 70s style room.”
Reviews.Author: Halcyon11
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic in this tiny hotel. The bedroom, although small, was perfect in every way - an amazing 70s style design. Delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: jetset1974
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff. Fantastic location. Our room was upgraded for some reason. We were in 501 with a partial view of the Pantheon and Rue St Jacques below. Contrary to a previous review - I found Rue St Jacques very quiet compared to some of the surrounding streets. Loved the hotel's design. Loved the Nespresso coffee maker in the lounge. Honesty bar was a bit expensive but love the concept. Great area of Paris. We went to a fabulous restaurant La Ferrandaise the 2nd night - this was recommended by the staff there and they graciously rang and inquired about bookings for us. When there were concerns about possible flight cancellations and my mobile phone wasn't working, the staff let me ring the airline to check up on the flights...not many hotels that would do that for you. Fantastic hotel and worth every centime...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Petit Paris”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Le Petit Paris last weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. In my view, this hotel deserves the excellent reviews it has been getting. I’ve given it a 4 rating because I think that a 5 may raise false expectations. That said, it certainly met (probably exceeded) what I was expecting! It’s hard to add anything that hasn’t been said already but …… It’s easy to get to Le Petit Paris by RER (Blue Line B) direct from CDG. Somebody else had posted directions to the Hotel from Luxembourg RER station – that was helpful to us so I’ll repeat them for others: come out of the station by the exit to Rue Gay Lussac, as you come up the last escalator cross the road at the zebra crossing directly in front of you. Turn right at the corner where McDonalds is then walk up towards The Pantheon. Turn right again into Rue St Jacques (Crepes a Go-Go is on the corner on the opposite side of the road). Le Petit Paris is on your right a couple of hundred yards down the road. The welcome we received was friendly and very efficient – full marks there. Our room 402 was lovely. Like most Paris hotels it wasn’t massive but it was plenty big enough for us and there was way more cupboard space than I had expected. The standard of furnishings was very high and the bed was very comfortable indeed. There is quite a lot of traffic on Rue St Jacques but you couldn’t hear a thing as the double glazing is so effective. The shower was lovely (yes ours leaked a bit too but it wasn’t a big deal). Everything was spotlessly clean. We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel as we preferred to go out each day but the free coffee and tea in the little lounge area was welcome and the “honesty” bar works well. I can’t remember all of the prices but it was 5 Euros for a glass of wine. We loved the location of the hotel – so close to The Pantheon and the Sorbonne, St Germain etc. We spent a very pleasant couple of hours in the Jardin de Luxembourg. It really is my favourite area of Paris. There is a plethora of cafes, restaurants etc within easy walking distance. Our favourite, recommended by the hotel, was Restaurant Perraudin – out of the hotel and turn left and it’s towards the corner of Rue St Jacques. The 3 course menu was just under 30 Euros, with 5 or 6 choices for each course. The food was fabulous. There didn’t seem to be any need to book – it’s open for lunch and dinner. We also tried the Comptoir de Pantheon which was good too. All in all, we had a really relaxing time (apart from the miles and miles we walked around Paris that is!) and we would return to Le Petit Paris without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: IrishDaddyMummyBaby
Reviews.Content: I can't quite say enough about this hotel that has not been said on previous reviews. Service perfect, room perfect, clean perfect, location perfect, breakfast mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: morisson
Reviews.Content: Our relatively small room, with a georgeous balcony had everything that you could possibly need. We stayed in the medieval suite on the fourth floor.The staff were incredibly attentive to our needs at all times. The coffeemaker on the lounge floor was always available and made perfect coffee. The designer furniture on the first floor fits in perfectly with the rest of the hotel without being too much, just perfectly comfy. There was a small malfunction in the shower as the water kept leaking onto the floor and towels were needed to make it passable but it was a small insignificant thing compared to the comfort of the hotel. Absolutely felt like home this hotel and I would reccommend it for both business and leisure. The next trip, work or pleasure will absolutely be at the Le petit paris.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy classy boutique hotel in the middle of the action.”
Reviews.Author: millertism
Reviews.Content: This hotel sure looked good at the end of busy days of walking and riding the Paris Metro. The staff is friendly, knowledgable and accommodating of us barely competent French speakers. There was no concierge, per se. The bed was comfy and the shower was great (overhead and hand-held options). The little lights in the bathroom tile panels were a hoot! Breakfast was plentiful, tasty and nutritious. Lots of baked goodies and fruit. We especially appreciated the carafe of freshly made drip coffee. The only caveat I can think of is that there really wasn't room for our two suitcases (there is a rack for one), but that's small potatoes compared to the welcoming atmosphere and the comfortable facilities. Street noise was not an issue. It would be fun to enjoy petit dejeuner out in the garden once the weather warms up. The metro (Cardinal Lemoine/Place Monge) is a good five minutes' walk, and the RER train (Luxembourg Gardens) is about two minutes' walk.

Reviews.Title: “Le Petit Paris is a petit charm in the city of lights”
Reviews.Author: AJ-List
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful, attentive and friendly. They knew the area and suggested a few very nice restaurants and a great Jazz club just around the corner. The rooms, though small, were ergonomically perfect. Weird to say, but the bathroom with the rain shower and LED starlights set in the grout were stunning and luxurious. The area is fantastic to stroll with the close proximity to Lux. Gardens, the Sorbonne and Pantheon, but a little out of the way as a home base to explore the city - The closest Metro is 7 blocks. However, the RER just around the corner made for a quick trip to and from CDG. In closing, I would suggest for leisure, but not so easy for a business trip with the inevitable back and forth from the hotel for meetings, dinner, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but a truly wonderful hotel with an excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: upwest74
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal for business and leisure travel. The RER B can be taken from CDG airport to Luxembourg Garden stop, and the hotel is just around the corner. Spend a bit more to get hte deluxe room, as the regular room is a bit on the small side. Howere the design elements of the rooms (especially the bathrooms), make up for the small space. The hotel staff was very helpful and extremly attentive. Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: VickiIOM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and had a very comfortable stay. All the positive reviews before me I agree with. Room was beautifully deocorated, clean and cosy, yes the rooms was small which my husband did not like, we had breakfast which was fine. The lounge area was great and a nice cup of tea was nice when you got back after a long day out, the honesty bar seemed OK it was nicely set out. Staff were all freindly and helpful. The area was nice and seemed safe enough to walk around there was a sporst bar near by which was handy for a quick one and the bistro opposite was good. All in all a good trip away.

Reviews.Title: “A cold weekend in paris but a warm stay at this design hotel...”
Reviews.Author: islabery
Reviews.Content: As a couple, we wanted a central location in a smaller, boutique hotel as we were only in Paris for 2 nights. As others have said on here, it is completly understandable (and deserved) as to why the hotel is ranked so high; the staff are very helpful, the decor is impressive, and you really feel like you are in your own boutique parisian paradise. That being said, our overall 'very good' rating just misses out on 'excellent' due to a couple of relatively minor points, most of which can easily be rectified as the hotel grows older (it is only recently opened). Namely, Valentines weekend in Paris was extremely cold (negative degrees) and unfortunately one evening our air con just wouldnt stop blowing cold air into our room- we called reception who, while very polite, couldnt help rectify the problem. Fortunately the duvets in the room are both extremely comfortable and very warm, so we managed! The minor detail points referenced above include having an electrical socket near the shower (!), missing towel racks, no place to put amentities while showering, and a broken light (wires hanging out). These can be forgiven as the hotel is finding its feet, but still need to be rectified - a standout hotel is one that pays attention to all the little details. Those comments, however, did not take away from a fantastic stay- we were near a ton of boulangeries which all make fantastic bread, some very nice bistro's as well as the Jardin du luxembourg. Yes- the hotel is near a subway. But i implore you- dont get on it..WALK..this is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great review”
Reviews.Author: carpetdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Thursday the 21st January-superior room Beautiful -the room looked as though I had been the first visitor House keeping is superb Lovely high end design and a wonderful hotel for couples or solo on business Extremely helpful and friendly staff Oh and the shower is fantastic Location is great 5 mins walk to blue line which takes you straight in from CDG so no nightmare with cases through busy streets Paid 192 euros breakfast is 10 euros-I think Stay Here !!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paul603
Reviews.Content: I stayed that the Hotel Le Petit Paris for an extended weekend in November at the end of a business trip in Europe and I was not disappointed. I choose the hotel on the basis of the reviews of trip advisor which ranked then the hotel as #1 in Paris. I feel that the current ranking, slightly lower, is more in line with reality. As mentioned in many reviews it is a lovely boutique hotel in a wonderful location and with an outstanding staff. Our room, albeit being one of the largest one, was fairly small but well appointed and very comfortable for a leisure stay. However, I would not recommend it for a business stay as it would be very difficult do any work in the absence of a desk. The only small round table in the room and associated armchairs are not appropriate for that purpose. The bath room with its LED lighting was spectacular but not very functional. The small balcony is lovely but, unfortunately, we could not take advantage of it due to the weather. In short, Le Petit Paris is a wonderful place for a romantic visit to Paris but it may not be as appropriate for a business traveler who needs to work in the room

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel - at a price”
Reviews.Author: Smifffy22b
Reviews.Content: 4 stops from the Gare du Nord Eurotunnel terminal, the hotel is on a quiet spur away from the madding crowd. South of the river is an up and coming area and the recent hotel refurb reflects that. The hotel is small, but that's a benefit, not a criticism. The facilities, attitude and friendliness of the staff is 1st rate and you'll not be left wanting for any of the larger hotel bits after staying. The hotel seems to be a town house which has been converted. The owner explained that it used to be a hostel type of hotel and needed a huge amount of work to get it to the state it's in now. The design approach seems extremely contemporary with lovely touches throughout. I'll post some photos, but there's a modern take on the chandelier in reception, a bookcase with jauntily arranged vibrantly coloured boxes, an unusual raised wallpaper and a Space 1999 type sit in bubble seat. Words don't do it justice. We took the suite which is up on the 1st floor. The room was fairly spacious - although some of my friends' rooms were not. The suite has an en suite bathroom and a riased wardrobe area. All colours are warm and welcoming. The TV had more channels than I've seen in a long time although there was no DVD or stereo. (which you'd expect at this price point). The bathroom was nicely done with a TV above the bath. Only compliant here is that it's a bit small - taller people will struggle in this bath. The shower is great though. Another nice touch is that the air con (if you use it) is quiet, whisper quiet. I didn't have the breakfast so can't comment, but this was down to the honesty bar which damaged me beyond a midday wake up call. All of this comes at a bit of a price though - but exclusivity usually does.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - we loved everything about the hotel. Staff were extremely helpful.”
Reviews.Author: kitkatbaby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights when we were in Paris for New Year. We had such a wonderful time. As other have said unless you know what you're looking for it is very easy to walk past the hotel on Rue St Jacques as there is only a subtle sign next to the entrance. However, it was very simple to get to the hotel from the airport (it was about a 30-40 min journey (check which train you get as some are "quick trains" which only stop at 3 or 4 stations others seem to stop at every station)) . The train station (Luxembourg) is only a 5 min walk from the hotel. Each room at the hotel is styled in a different way. We stayed in room 503 which was a 70's style room. As with all hotel rooms they're not big but that didn't matter to me. The decor was lovely and we had an amazing view across the rooftops of Paris including a view of the Eiffel tower in the distance. The whole room was finished to a good standard. There was also small mini bar hidden in the cupboard (i think it was either 3 or 4 euros for a can of coke). There is a lounge area next to the reception on the ground floor where you can help yourself to complimentary tea or coffee all day. The lounge as with the rest of the hotel was very stylish and very relaxing. Between 6 pm and 12pm there is an honesty bar that operates which seems to work very well. There was a good choice of drinks. The free wifi throughout the hotel was also a bonus. There was a laptop in the lounge that guests could use. One thing that i couldn't rate highly enough about the hotel was the staff. They were the best reception staff i have ever had to deal with. Alexandra deserves a special mention. She was so, so helpful! Alexandra recommended and booked some fabulous restaurants for us throughout our time in Paris. She also helped my husband to suprise me with some beautiful flowers. Her English was perfect and she was more than willing to help us improve our very dodgy French. The only hint of a negative thing that i could say about the hotel was that a couple of the rooms appear to back on to the lift shaft and you can hear the noise when you're in the rooms but it didn't bother me at all. There are only approx 20 rooms at the hotel and as such the lift didn't seem to be used too often. As to the rest of Paris we loved it all. The Pantheon and Notre Dame were only 5-10 mins walk away. There were lots of lovely cafe's in Saint Germain. We also loved having a walk around the Latin Quarter. The only place that dissapointed was the famous cafe Angelina's. Having queued up outside for 10 mins with high hopes of the best hot chocolate in Paris what i was actually met with was a horrible drink and a very rude waitress. I wouldn't waste my time going back there. We'll definiately be going back to Le Petite Paris Hotel the next time we are in Paris. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - very chic, but so comfortable that you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: JackRussellLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel, near the Pantheon. The hotel seems to have been decorated recently and the decor is very up to date and well chosen. We had a deluxe room and it was lovely. The room had a small private outside roof terrace outside - shame it was too cold (in December) to use it! The bathroom had a large "monsoon" shower and sparkling LED lights. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast cost 10 euros and was very good. There is a lounge, where you can help yourself to hot drinks and madeleines during the day and an "honesty bar" for the evening. The location of the hotel is very good for the Jardins de Luxembourg and Odeon district (and shopping streets!). The Pantheon is a couple of minutes' walk away and it's not too far to walk to the Ile St Louis. The Luxembourg RER is quite close and is on a quick, direct RER line from the Gare Du Nord. Overall, highly recommended - we felt really relaxed and at home there.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrsC_668
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at le petit paris for 3 nights between xmas and New Year and absolutely loved it! On arrival Alexandra greeted us and was extremely helpful in making restaurant bookings and advising us on where to go. Our room (104) was on the small side but had some clever design making the most of the space available. It was exceptionally clean (with housekeeping visiting our room each day), very comfortable, quiet and very chic. The bathroom was gorgeous with a rainfall style power shower which was good and essential after being out in the cold sightseeing all day! The location of the hotel is good, a short walk to many bars and restaurants, the pantheon and Luxembourg gardens, and only a few mins away from the metro station which gave us easy access to all the must see sites in Paris. There’s an honesty bar at the hotel which we used (although a little pricey but that’s no different to anywhere in Paris) but the tea and coffee was free which was good as there wasn’t a facility to make hot drinks in our room. We had a little difficulty finding the hotel so here’s a (hopefully) useful tip – as you come out of Luxembourg metro station (if you come up the escalator exit Rue Gay Lussac) walk straight ahead, cross the junction and turn right at McDonalds. Walk up this road and then turn right once you reach Crepes a Gogo on your left (which is a good place for breakfast), walk along this street and after a short while the hotel is on your right. We’d definitely stay at this hotel again if on a return visit to Paris and we’d recommend it to others as during our stay we couldn't find fault with it.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay here don't look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: The_Mayo_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here from the 30.12.09 to the 3.01.09 at a rate of €224 per night with this been a superior room. The room was number 302 and had a 1920s theme. Hotel is very easy to get to from the luxembourg railway station which travels directly from charles de gaulle airport. Yes this is a small hotel but it has plenty of character. When we we arrived we were given a map and directions to the various sites of Paris. We were shown the honesty bar which is a very good idea and worked fine for us. There's also tea or coffee available 24hours a day free of charge and you just make as much as you want. Our room was perfect and from the pictures and videos i have uploaded you will see that it was worth the money been charged. I agree that the water goes on to the bathroom florr and you have to clean it but come on dont knock the hotel for this as its a VERY MINOR problem and not worth talking anymore about. Also you don't need to worry about room service knocking on your door in the morning as they will only enter the room when you tell reception . The location is perfect and taxis and the railway line are on the doorstep. I have to admit that we paid 58 euro for a taxi from the airport! My wife likes to get to a hotel on the first night by taxi so i caved in and got the taxi. When we checked into the hotel the taxi driver entered reception looking for us and i was in shocked when he handed us 10 euro as in error we over paid him. I have to say this gave a great impression of honest french taxi drivers. Please note we did travel by the railway when we were returning home at a lower cost of €3.20! As i said eariler the honest worked fine and if you are not familiar with same it basically means that a price list is left beside the various drinks and you just take what you want. You then write down on a menu provided what you got and when you have finished drinking for the evening you leave the menu into reception who charge this to your room. Theres a mini bar in your room which contains minerals at a cost of €3.Breakfast ranges from 10 to 15 euro per person per day. We didn't use this as we are not breakfast people. Theres also a laptop provided in the lobby with unlimited internet access. Overall i have to say this was a our first time to travel to Paris and i did this for my wifes 30th birthday. We also travelled to eurodisney and was easy to reach via the railway. The hotel is welcoming, warm, friendly and nothing is any problem. We will be back time and time again. Send me a mesage if you want any further information

Reviews.Title: “New Boutique Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover7
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, staff could not do enough-thank you Laticia and Alexandra. Contempary chic design with nice entrance lobby area. Spotless, shiny and new.We were informed the Hotel only opened in Sept 09 and that may be the reason for a few unfortunate teething problems. 1) Shower leaks through door and onto floor and is a pain, mopping after a shower with towels-not much fun. 2) Lack of storage is an issue, could be sorted with a chest of drawers, also no bathroom cabinet, mirror steams up, needs a heated mirror, yep I am fussy but at two-three hundred euros a night.......... These issues are a bit of a surprise to me as there has been major investment in the building and very chic/classy decor, but it is early days and staff informed me that works to fix the shower/s were being carried out just after Christmas. Definitely good for two people, not sure about three in a room, apparently they have a bigger triple room? Gave me discount on checking out, thank you, staff were very apologetic and aware of the issues and I have no doubt they will address same asap. Good place to stay, overall Paris is kinda pricy compared to London, but what an amazing city if you havn`t been dont miss it!

Reviews.Title: “our new favourite hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: johnfarside
Reviews.Content: Paris is our favourite city and we travel there at least once or twice a year from Dublin. We have stayed in lots of hotels, generally 3 star boutique hotels that tend to be more interesting than the boring, corporate style in the expensive 5 star hotels where you could be in any city in the world. The amenities in this type of hotel tend to be limited, but that's fine by us - we are there to see Paris, not sit in the hotel all day. In this hotel there isn't actually even room service (although they had a bottle of Champage waiting on ice in my room on arrival, as requested) - there is an 'Honesty Bar' where you take what you want and fill in a form that they collect and bill you for when you're paying at the end of your stay. This is our new favourite hotel in Paris. It's small and modern, brand new and near to lots of nice restaurants, bars, shops, metro, etc. The hotel is obviously very new, but the staff were literally more helpful than in any other hotel i've stayed in europe - nothing was too much trouble. While the bedroom was small, it was very well equipped, and the decor (every bedroom is different) was really nice. We stayed in the 'medievil' style room on the top floor and it was really fantastic. In short, I couldn't recommend this hotel enough, if you don't mind the 'cosyness' of this type of 3 star hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous funky small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamLippy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small but comfortable hotel in a great location you will do no better than Le Petit Paris. The staff are very helpful and you get nothing is too much trouble. We have found a little Gem and as frequent visors to Paris will certainly be using this hotel again It wont suit everyones taste,no grand restaurants or cocktail bar with hundreds of tourists and business men,but then who would want that anyway.Not us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alderwasley
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel if you're looking for a small, designer boutique hotel in Paris. Situated on rue St Jacques no more than 15 mins walk from Notre Dame. It's only recently opened so it's still bright and shiny! The staff speak excellent English and are only to willing to help. There's no restaurant and breakfast is served in the reception area which doubles as a lounge area. If you haven't travelled to Paris before, hotel rooms do tend to be small and this is no exception - but they make up for it with the quality of decor and fixtures/fittings - perfect if you want to stay somewhere different. Our room was on the 5th floor and the glazing was strong enough to block out most noise. We had a problem with the hot water pressure on both mornings - I don't think there system is capable of providing everyone with hot water at the same time. In the end, we just needed to be patient. The staff were apologetic and promised to raise it with the manager. So in summary, good location in the latin quarter, beautiful design, polite and friendly staff and definately a thumbs up for a boutique hotel - but be prepared, the rooms are small. One final point to note, due to the size of hotel, all rooms in the main building seem to be close to the lift so you will hear it running but given that there can't be more than 3 rooms per floor and 5 floors, it doesn't intrude on your sleep. However the room walls are very thin so you can hear the people next door!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly funky hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hippymidget
Reviews.Content: A fantastic little hotel, and I Love the area. Coming out of the metro station (direct from CDG airport by the way, very handy!) and seeing the glorious Panthéon lit up at night took my breath away. Standing at the crossroad on Rue St Jacques you can admire the Panthéon on one side, and look across to the Eiffel Tower on the other - Paris encapsulated =D Had a little trouble finding the hotel at first - we'd actually walked straight past it! The outside front is very small and understated, easy to miss. But it makes it all the more special when you get inside and discover such a chic interior. We stayed in room 301, so not such a glamorous view from the window but a really great room nonetheless - it's a red 'Medieval style' room, although the link to anything actually Medieval is tenuous - but hey, it's a holiday, not a history trip! =) The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom stunning (although small). The shower was a delight =) The windows are all triple glazed, so it was very quiet - but also very hot at night. After tinkering with the air con we did manage to maintain a comfortable temperature without needing to open the window and let in traffic noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful; even before our arrival I had no problems telephoning to discuss various things, and they were always extremely polite. The room was kept clean, and any other requests such as extra little things for the bathroom/Wifi code/recommended restaurants were met quickly and efficiently. The WiFi works great by the way - good for entertainment if you're not a fan of French television or dubbed programmes ;) The area surrounding the hotel is extremely good. In fact I think the Cinquième (5th) arrondissement is my favourite in all of Paris. It's easy walking/metro distance from the main areas of town and the touristy sights, but just far enough away to make eating out at a reasonable price possible. There are plenty of bars and restaurants on offer too, and thanks to the Sorbonne's proximity the nightlife atmosphere is fun and lively but not rowdy. It's also a very beautiful area - one road away from the Luxembourg gardens and a short walk from the Seine. I would love to go back! But this class of hotel is usually out of my price range. Thankfully, there seem to be good deals available online for this particular hotel, so it's worth shopping around. For a romantic holiday to spoil your partner it's worth it =)

Reviews.Title: “chic , compact Parisien hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertCDublin
Reviews.Content: This chic little bolthole is situated at the top of Rue st Jacque. On arrival we were greeted warmly by very efficient staff. Hotel decour is modern and bright.. We stayed in room 502 at the top of the building so watch your head when in the typically small bedrooms. Notwithstanding the small space the room was excellent. Our stay was made memorable by the excellent staff. Hotel is around the corner from the lovely Jardin du Luxembourg and the RER station with direct 40min connection to CDG Airport. We'll return here again and would recommend to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find ... Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: selectivediva
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a 3 day weekend at the Hotel le Petit Paris and enjoyed every minute of my stay. The hotel is well located, steps from the RER Green line and walking distance of almost everything on the left bank. The rooms are well appointed, although on the small side - but this is Paris, so nothing larger should be expected. The front desk staff was very welcoming and accommodating - responding quickly to every request. I will most definitely return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: drysdales
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, but not hugely expensive, hotel in a good part of Paris and were lucky to find the Petit Paris as part of a deal with Eurostar. The hotel is new and the rooms, although not huge, are perfectly formed, with a fantastic power shower, a comfortable mattress and wonderful, helpful, reception staff. The free tea and coffee were very welcome at the end of the day and the breakfast was excellent and reasonable in comparison with what was on offer elsewhere. The Hotel is about five minutes walk from the Luxembourg underground stop on line B and is close to the Luxembourg Gardens and plenty of good bars and restaurants. We would love to stay there again and would happily recommend the hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paris987
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I was very impressed. Very beautiful rooms and lounge area, good breakfast & location, affordable for what you get. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. A true gem. Next time I travel to Paris, I'll know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect! very Paris!”
Reviews.Author: stephma
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay last week end at hotel le petit paris. It is located in the best area, perfect for the christmas shopping; nice resaturants around and advised by the reception. Room was very cute and clean. Design furniture in the entrance made me want redecorate my living room! Very cozy also!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fionfion
Reviews.Content: Le Petit Paris is a gem! Top class hotel, yet affordable for the standard you get. Love the luxurious yet warm and cosy ambiance. The staff is most helfpul. Go there! It's also perfectly located! Want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisstokes43
Reviews.Content: My partner and i decided to got to Paris for a 5 day city break. Having been to Paris many times before i love the St Germaine area and this hotel is in prime location. It is the best hotel i have stayed in my visits to Paris by a long way. The room was excellent and beautifully designed with a superb bathroom. The staff were extremely helpful and always catered to our needs. The one lady was very helpful and made our stay very special. Overall it was a great holiday and much of that is down to the hotel and staff. I will definitely go back next time i visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “très très bien”
Reviews.Author: lingschmetter
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before 12 o'clock hoping to be able to leave our luggage but to our surprise the room was already ready. We also got upgraded to the triple deluxe room which was beautiful. During the conversation with the very friendly receptionist we mentioned that we were hungry and she offered to prepare breakfast for us. The room was very clean, especially bathroom and toilet. The communal area felt like a living room, very friendly atmosphere. VERY happy experience, there wasn't anything that we didnt like and we can not wait to come back! PS: the cheaper rooms might be small but the decor and service definately make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Good Location - Helpful Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TommUK
Reviews.Content: We chose this newly opened hotel from all the good reviews and we were not dissapointed. The rooms are lovely, small/med size but very clean and modern and the beds are extremely comfortable indeed.The location is very good (approx 10 mins walk down street to Notre Dame). The service from all the staff and owners was very welcoming and helpful and they directed us to some lovely restaurants (Le Perraudin :classic french food - very near and great fillet steaks). Luxembourg Gardens are very near and are lovely. Also liked the St Germain area. Would recommend and definitely go back .

Reviews.Title: “" elle decor"- I want to move in.”
Reviews.Author: artwear
Reviews.Content: Great find ! Brand new and lovely, but its the people running it that make the important difference. Professional but warm and helpful when needed the hotel feels like home where you can meet your friends for a drink before or after dinner,go for a walk in the park or just explore. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Egremontonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a deluxe room at a 20% special opening discount off their normal rate (which is €320 per night). Our room number was 503 and was styled as the 'seventies', though having lived through the seventies I am happy to report that the decor of the room was much more stylish than I remember the seventies ever being, though it did have a brown and gold colour scheme, so that definitely did remind me of the seventies. The room was not excessively large but there was plenty of room to store 2 cases and still be able to walk around. Where there is a deficiency is in the storage, only two rather narrow wardrobe and shelves at either side of the bed and in one of those the bottom 2 shelves were taken up by the mini-bar (which only contained soft drinks) leaving only the 5 hangers and a top shelf. The presence of the mini-bar also made this storage area rather warm, so not a place to keep your chocolate supply! We had a queen sized bed which was very comfortable. There was also a table and two chairs in the room and a standard lamp. There was also a Television in the room but only French channels were available. The bathroom was also very stylish with LED lighting in the wall of the shower and the shower itself being an overhead rainwater type with a separate hand held 'wand' also fitted. The bathroom did have a couple of little annoyances, the first that there was nowhere to hang your hand towel, so it ended up being folded on the shelf above the sink alongside our toiletries, there was also no shelf in the shower cubicle so you had to place your shower gel and shampoo on the ground, there was plenty of room for a shelf in the cubicle so this seemed a very strange omission. We could not fault the cleanliness of the room, towels were changed daily and both the bedroom and the bathroom were spotless. It was also a plus point that the hotel supplied toiletries were l'occitane, so good quality. We actually had a distant view of the eiffel tower from our room, at the back of the hotel, which was an unexpected bonus. We did wonder if those rooms on the front of the hotel may suffer from noise as rue at jacque is quite a busy road, though the windows are double glazed. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, however we were not told that in order for the lighting to operate you had to fit your room card into a slot, fortunately for us we arrived in daylight, those arriving in darkness may well have had more of a problem. The landing lights are fitted with PIR sensors but they did not operate quickly so if you switched off your room lights there was a moment where you were plunged into darkness. The hotel itself is not named on the outside, the only clue is a large vertical hotel sign hanging from the building, had we arrived on foot and not by taxi then I can imagine we may have struggled to find it (for those who do arrive on foot, it is across from a 'kebab' shop and just slightly diagonally across from a kitchenware shop). The public areas are stylish and quirky, difficult to describe but you can see for yourself on the hotels website. There is also, apparently free wi-fi in the hotel, certainly there was free internet available near to reception. There was also a coffee machine available free of use in the small seating area and the hotel ran an honesty bar.
