We did not have breakfast in the hotel (€10 for buffet continental plus €4 for omelette or plate of ham and cheese which you had to order in advance) but from what we saw of it the selection was cereals then various boulangerie products with a selection of jams. We actually had a 'breton' breakfast at the nearby cafe 'Crepes Agogo' on the corner of rue st jacques and rue sufflout, sugar crepe, coffee and fruit juice for €8.70. There are many places to eat nearby and the Luxembourg RER station is about 5 minutes away, the walk to the nearest Metro station (Cluny-La Sorbonne) is about 10 minutes and the walk to the river at Notre Dame about 15 minutes, allow more time for walking back up the not inconsiderable slope of Rue St Jacque. So, all in all we were more than happy with the hotel but are not sure it is worth the price, especially the normal undiscounted rates. We would not be unhappy to stay here again but the price may act as a deterrent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Born2Travel20
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough nice things about this hotel as it totally exceeded all of our expectations. We stayed at Le Petit the last week of October for five nights and at the time we booked the hotel two weeks before our trip, Le Petit was ranked on TripAdvisor in the high teens, but by the time we returned it had already risen to #2 (at time of this review). The owners have clearly invested a lot of money in upgrading and decorating the hotel. Each floor has its own style - we stayed on the 3rd floor which we were told was all decorated in a red scheme (apparently each floor has its own design scheme). The bathrooms were definitely the best...with small LED lights embedded across both the ceiling and the tiles on the side, a flat screen TV in the shower wall, and a great waterfall style shower that fell like rain from the ceiling around a light. It was neat to turn off the main lights and only shower with the LED & shower lights watching TV. While the room itself was on the small side (like most hotels in Europe), it was very clean and modern with nice decor. The windows opened so we could enjoy the cool fresh air...not much of a view from our room but it was nice and quiet. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful...particularly Alexandra who spoke very good English. There was an honor bar each night with a great selection of wines, spirits, beer, and other beverages. We elected not to have breakfast at the hotel since there were so many other choices nearby, but it did look very inviting. The location was great with so many restaurants, cafes, brassieres (bars), bakeries, grocery stores, shops, etc. within a couple of blocks of the hotel. The Pantheon was also a couple of blocks up the street and the RER Luxembourg train/metro stop was only 3 mins walk. When the weather was nice (which happened to be four of the five days), we would stop at a bakery and walk into Luxembourg Gardens (3 mins away) to have our breakfast in the morning sun. In the evenings, it was very convenient to have the local bars very close to the hotel...there were many choices within a short radius. The WOS bar a block away was really nice with a great selection of drinks and beer from around the world, a very happening local bar called Le Pantheon literally around the corner, and a bunch of brassieres on Rue Soufflot (next to the Pantheon). A short ten minute walk and we found ourselves on Boulevard Saint-Germain where there are tons of restaurants, cafes, shops, nightlife, and action...very busy with so many dinner choices it will make your head spin. Being right next to Luxembourg RER, it was extremely convenient coming from Charles De Gaule airport with a direct train (RER B) straight from the airport to Luxembourg station and then a short 3 minute walk to the hotel. However, it was hard to see the hotel (we walked straight past it with our luggage) as there is only a generic blue "Hotel" sign high above, and while it doesn't look like much from the street, once inside it is definitely a nice boutique hotel. There are also a couple of small grocery/convenience stores next door where we bought water, wine, food, and soft drinks for the room which we put in the small minibar. There is a hair dryer in the room but no iron, so we had to use the hotel pressing service (no service on Sunday). We were completely happy and wouldn't change our selection of hotel if we had the chance. Le Petit would certainly be our first choice in Paris...we just hope that the fact it is ranked so high won't hurt our chances of finding availability or increase the price in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent and very wimsical”
Reviews.Author: lyndenSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very accidentily and we were very surprised how wonderful and beautiful it was. The staff (Laetetia) and everyone was so helpful. Yes the rooms are small but cozy and comfortable. Loved the rain shower. We enjoyed our 2day stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming”
Reviews.Author: iminireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and it was my first time to Paris, reading the reviews of the different areas to stay in Paris confused our decision of where to stay, so we decided to book here based on its popularity and the glowing reviews. The rooms are not small, they are tiny. The hotel has great decor and the staff are good. I can't say I found the price to be great value but maybe all hotels in this city are expensive and maybe all have tiny rooms too. The location was pretty good, only a few minutes walk to Luxemburg station, very handy to get to CDG Airport and any part of Paris. Moving around on the Metro to all the sights was easy. It is only a ten minute walk to the heart of the Latin Quarter which has great bars and restaurants. Won't be coming back to stay in this hotel again anytime soon as I reckon there are other hotels with better value, just have to find them (I hope!). TIPS!!! One thing to be aware of in restaurants is service is included in the bill, not very clear on the receipt and the only thing they don't bother to translate into english on the menus.

Reviews.Title: “Great design bargain”
Reviews.Author: anicdu
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and were very pleased. The rooms were on the small side but very nicely decorated with good attention to detail. In general the hotel was very clean and tidy, but was missing a few things (like a mirror in the lobby toilets). Location is OK, depending on what you like to do in Paris and which areas you like to hang around in. The hotel lacked the services of larger hotels, but this is more than compensated for by the low price, espicially if you're only there for leisure and don't need things like a quick laundry service, proper restaurant, business center etc. Staff was very friendly and service minded, always. All in all, a near perfect hotel for a Paris weekend on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful sojourn on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: EllaInParis
Reviews.Content: We organised two nights here at the last minute and were absolutely amazed! The Hotel is beautiful, the atmostphere is gorgeous and the staff could not have been more helpful. The location is right on a street of foodie treats and a short stroll away from the Luxembourg Gardens for the best picnic ever. I can't wait to go back.
